Her dream for the future is to open a store to the general public, to diversify into other businesses. While she builds on her dream she will continue to put effort into finding sales that will impact her income, to generate a profit margin of no less than 35%, and to keep her inventory rotation schedule of 10 days. This is her third loan with Yehu Microfinance Trust (Kiva Field Partner) and with it she plans on purchasing bundles of fish for resale and pay for transport. Her clients have placed orders and this predicts a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Jesulome Group

texts.fr: JESULOME est un groupement de vingt trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même village et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Julienne (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un certain Adjaï. Le couple a sept enfants dont certains scolarisés dont quatre restent à leur charge. Julienne et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Julienne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de vingt ans que Julienne mène comme activité la vente du maïs et de l’huile végétale dans une ville du Bénin et à son domicile. Julienne exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Julienne s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Julienne sollicite un troisième crédit avec les autres membres du groupement JESULOME. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: JESULOME is a group of 23 people who all live in the same village and belong to the same savings group.  The leader of the group, Julienne, whose hand is raised in the photo, is 46 years old and married to a man named Adjaï.  The couple has seven children, some of whom attend school, and four of whom remain in their care.  Julienne and her husband live with their children and together they meet their different household needs.  Julienne did not attend school.  For nearly 20 years, she has been in the business of selling corn and vegetable oil in a city in Bénin and from her home.  She is enthusiastic about her work, which allows her to meet her needs and those of her children.  She gets her supplies in her own region.  In the hopes of meeting the demand of her customers, Julienne, along with the other members of the JESULOME group, is requesting a third loan.  This loan will allow them to meet the demand of their customers and to make higher profits.  The previous loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy corn and palm wine.

loans.name: La Vida Nueva Group

texts.es: Griselda tiene 27 años de edad y es originaria de una comunidad llamada Macho de Agua cerca de su casa se encuentra el PDA de Visión Mundial México, ella tiene 2 hijos una niña de 5 años y un niño de un año y está casada con Israel el cual es albañil en la ciudad de México. Platica que ella es parte de un grupo llamado La Nueva Vida y dice que le pusieron ese nombre porque dice que su vida ha cambiado a través de los créditos que VisionFund les ha otorgado dice que si nueva vida es mejor ya que le ha dado a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y ella ahora se siente mejor porque tiene un negocio propio en el cual a descubierto habilidades que antes no la había notado más que nada como el negociar con la gente, ella se dedica a vender ropa como chamarras, pants, sudaderas, calcetas, calcetines ropa interior para niños y damas y dice que tiene con su negocio desde hace un poco más de 6 años y cada 15 días surte su ropa en la ciudad de México y en Moroleón ya que ahí le dan bajos precios y también por que compra directo de fabricantes. El crédito le beneficiara por que  tendrá surtido su negocio de ropa y tendrá más variedad, dice que su meta es poder hacer un local en su casa ya que no tiene uno estable por que la ropa la ofrece de casa en casa a sus clientas. Las otras tres integrantes del grupo se llaman Fabiola, Vianey y Juana ellas invertirán sus créditos para la compra de zapatos por catalogo para vender a clientela, compra de alimento y compra de cerdos para cría y después venderlos.
texts.en:
Griselda, 27, is from a community called Macho de Agua.  The Visión Mundial México offices are near her house.  She has two children, a five-year-old girl and a one-year-old boy.  She’s married to Israel who works in construction in Mexico City.  

She relates that she’s part of a group called “La Nueva Vida” (The New Life) and she says they named it thus because she says their life has changed through the Vision Fund loans they’ve been granted.  She says that her new life is better because she’s given her children better quality of life and now she feels better because she has a business of her own where she’s discovered that she has skills she’d never noticed before, above all how to negotiate with people.

She sells clothes like jackets, pants, sweatshirts, stockings, socks and children’s and women’s underwear.  She says that she’s had the business for a little more than six years and she stocks up on clothes every fifteen days in Mexico City and Moroleón because she gets lower prices there and also because she can buy directly from the manufacturers.

The loan will be beneficial because she’ll have a good stock of clothes and she’ll have more variety.  She says her goal is to be able to open a locale at home because she does not now have a stable one and she sells clothes to her customers from house to house.

The other three group members are Fabiola, Vianey and Juana and they are going to invest their loans in the purchase of shoes by catalogue to resell to customers, to buy animal feed and to buy pigs to raise and then sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
MARIA GLORIA tiene 28 años de edad es soltera tiene 28 años de edad vive con los padres en la ciudad de Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

María Gloria se dedica  a la confección de ternos, vestidos ella es costurera. Solicita el crédito para comprar 1 máquina de cocer, comprar hilos, tela de todo color.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que tanta falta le hace. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia. El sueño e spoder ahorrar y comprar una casa para vivir mejor.

 En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en: MARIA GLORIA is 28 years old, is single, and lives with her parents in the city of Guaranda in the province of Bolivar.  Maria Gloria is a seamstress who sews suits and other clothing items.  She is requesting this loan to buy 1 sewing machine, and to buy thread and fabric of all colors.  With the help of the loan she will be able to buy things that she badly needs.  The challenge that she is facing is competition.  Her dream is to be able to save and to buy a house in order to have a better life.  In her spare time she enjoys sports.

loans.use: to buy 1 sewing machine, and to buy thread and fabric in all colors.

loans.name: Willmar Anibal

texts.es:
Willmar es un hombre de 28 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su pareja y sus 2 pequeños hijos a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Willmar no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos momentos con su familia y en alguna de estas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Willmar trabaja como panadero en la panadería de su padre, elaborando deliciosos panes, biscochos y otros, todos los días desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Willmar se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una cocina, la cual le servirá de mucho ya que actualmente cuenta con una pequeña cocina que está en malas condiciones y al usarla es muy peligrosa; de esta manera Willmar tendrá una cocina en mejores condiciones la cual brinde mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para que junto con su familia pueda salir adelante.
texts.en:
Willmar is 28 years old, and lives in the city of Ica with his partner and their 2 children.  He loves his family, and they are his main reason for living.  He is a very pleasant, enthusiastic, and hardworking man.  He and his partner dedicate all of their efforts to helping their family get ahead.  Willmar had hoped to study for a professional career but unfortunately could not due to a lack of financial resources, and he instead had to work to support himself.  In his spare time he likes spending time with his family, and on occasion he cooks them a delicious Arroz con Pollo (chicken and rice).  

Willmar works very hard and enthusiastically as a baker at his father’s bakery, where he bakes delicious breads, pastries, and other items.  He works every day, starting in the early morning and then working for about 10 hours.  He thinks things are going well because of his dedication and his kind treatment of others.

Willmar is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since their support will make it possible for him to purchase a stove.  This will be of great use to him, since he currently has a small stove that is in bad condition and is very dangerous to use.  With the loan Willmar will be able to buy a stove that is in better condition, which will be safer for his family and improve their wellbeing.  Willmar is going to continue working and striving so that he and his family can get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase a stove.

loans.name: Lilliana Patricia

texts.es: Liliana, casada, madre de tres hijos, de 32 años de edad, de oficio comerciante se dedica a atender una pulpería en su casa de habitación, ella habita en Tipitapa municipio de Managua. Tiene 12 años trabajando en el área de comercio, inicio trabajando a la edad de 20 años cuando salía a vender con su mama, quien la motivo a emprender su propio negocio. Su esposo la apoyo comprándole un frízer, comenzó a vender productos lácteos, jugos, galletas, snacks. Poco  a poco fue incrementando su clientela y logro poner su pequeña pulpería. Está requiriendo el crédito para comprar arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar, leche, huevo, crema, mantequilla, jugos, gaseosas, productos de limpieza pues son parte de los productos más demandados por sus clientes. Esto le será de mucha ayuda pues conseguirá suplir parte de las necesidades de sus clientes, además de mejorar sus ingresos. Uno de sus proyectos que desea realizar es poner una pequeña tienda de ropa y variedades, que le permita obtener otros ingresos para ahorrar y pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Liliana is 32, married, and the mother of three children.  A merchant by occupation, she runs a small general store in her home. She lives in Tipitapa, in Managua municipality.

She has been working in the retail area for 12 years. She began this work at the age of 20, when she used to go out to sell with her mother, who encouraged her to start her own business.

Her husband helped by buying her a freezer, and she began to sell dairy products, juices, cookies and snacks. Little by little she began to increase her clientele, and managed to set up a small general store.

She needs the loan to buy rice, cooking oil, beans, sugar, milk, eggs, cream, butter, juices, soft drinks and cleaning products, as they are some of the products in highest demand from her customers.

This will help her a great deal, as she will be able to stock some of her customers' necessities, besides improving her income.

One of the projects she wishes to undertake is to set up a small clothing and variety store. This will allow her to earn other income, so that she can save money and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking oil, beans, sugar, milk, eggs, cream, butter, juice, soft drinks and cleaning products.

loans.name: Danelia

texts.es:
Danelia , 60 años de edad, es originaria de Chinandega pero habita en Managua, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo mantiene al más pequeño que está estudiando en la universidad. 
Ella se dedica a la Pulpería, la inicio vendiendo dulces, galletas, gaseosas, helados. Después fue creciendo poco a poco, actualmente tiene 9 años de tener este negocio, donde vende productos comestibles, de limpieza y de uso doméstico los cuales vende por unidad. 
Ella busca el financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, leche, huevo, mantequilla, pan, jugos, gaseosas, enlatados, sopas, baterías. Pues son productos de alto consumo en su negocio y necesita vender para no perder ingresos ni clientes. Uno de sus planes es tener una pequeña bodega donde puede almacenar productos al por mayor y solventar las alzas de los precios en los productos. Ella vende al contado y al crédito. Pero necesita invertir en más variedad de productos de precios más accesibles a su clientela para atender sus necesidades y es lo cual ella desea ampliarse más.
texts.en: Danelia is 60 years old and comes from Chinandega, but now lives in Managua.  She has 4 children, of whom only the youngest who is studying at university is still in her care.  She has a small grocery store, where she began selling sweets, cookies, soda and ice cream.  Later it grew little by little, and after 9 years of operating the store she now sells groceries, cleaning products and items for household use which are sold by the unit.  She is looking for financing to buy basic grains, milk, eggs, butter, bread, juice, soad, canned goods, soup and batteries.  Her products have a high turnover and in her business she must sell products in order not to lose either customers or income.  One of her plans is to have a small storeroom  where she can store wholesale products and be able to handle price increases in products. She sells for cash and on credit.  She needs to invest in a greater variety of products at prices more accessible to her customers in order to meet their needs and this is why she wants to expand.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, milk, eggs, butter, bread, juice, soda, canned goods, soup and batteries.

loans.name: Artesanos Group

texts.es: Petra tiene 49 años de edad y es parte de un grupo llamado Artesanos dice que tiene ese nombre el grupo porque la mayoría de sus integrantes se dedica hacer artesanía en barro y para que los ubicaran rápido decidieron ponerle ese nombre. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas esperanzas de salir adelante platica que se dedica a vender frutas y verduras de temporada en la central de abastos de una población cercana a la de ella ya que tiene una huerta de aguacate, durazno, nísperos, comenta que en este momento esta pidiendo un crédito a VisionFund para la compra de harina, azúcar, leche, huevo, mantequilla, levadura, leña para hornear ya que también se dedica a vender pan casa por casa y hay gente que le hace pedidos y también para comprar un poco de abono para sus arboles. Platica que el crédito le beneficiara por que tendrá la materia prima para hacer sus panes y para mejorar las condiciones de sus árboles y así con las ganancias poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. La meta que tiene es hacer crecer su huerto ya que hacer pan es muy pesado y así estar más al pendiente de su familia. Los otros seis integrantes del grupo se llaman Eusebia, Imelda, Elia, Elia Martínez, Claudia y Quirino ellos ocuparan sus créditos en la compra de material para hacer artesanía en barro, en compra y venta de frutas de temporada, en insumos para hacer tacos de diferentes carnes para vender, en artículos para surtir una tienda de abarrotes, en surtir diferentes tipos de flores de ornato.
texts.en:
Petra is 49 years old and is part of the communal bank group called "Artesanos" [Artisans]. They said that the group is called that because the majority of the members are artisans who work with clay, so they named themselves that so that they would be easily identifiable. Petra is a very hard working woman with a strong hope to get ahead. She told us that she earns a living selling seasonal fruit and vegetables in the market in an area close to where she lives. She has a garden that produces avocados, peaches and loquats. She said that the loan that is currently pending through VisionFund is to buy flour, sugar, milk, eggs, butter, yeast, and fire wood for her wood burning oven to make the bread, because she also makes money selling bread by going house to house and to people who place orders. A part of the loan will also be used to buy fertilizer for her trees.   

She said the loan will be beneficial to her because it will allow her to have raw materials to make her bread and to improve the conditions of her trees. With the profits she makes she will be able to give her family a better quality of life. Her goal is to increase the size of her garden, to depend less on the profits from her bread since baking is very time intensive, and that way she would be able to spend more time with her family.  

The other six group members are  Eusebia, Imelda, Elia, Elia Martínez, Claudia y Quirino. They will be using their shares of the loan to buy materials to make clay artisan products, to buy and resell seasonal fruits, to buy the ingredients for meat tacos, to buy supplies to restock a small corner store and to restock different types of ornamental flowers.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, milk, eggs, butter, yeast, and fire wood for her wood burning oven, to make the bread she sells by going house to house.

loans.name: Yanice Lorena

texts.es:
Yanice Lorena 
2012-265
500.000



 	Es una mujer de 38 años de edad, aparte del trabajo de comercio que realiza y la atención del hogar, ya que tiene 2 hijos menores de edad, es cocinera en el Liceo Ambientalista de Horquetas desde el 2010. Inició su negocio hace 3 años,  para ahorrar y apoyar a sus hijos en el estudio. Actualmente vive con ellos y su esposo. En un préstamo anterior demostró puntualidad en los pagos y le sirvió además de apoyo para el desarrollo de su negocio, el cual se ha mantenido en crecimiento desde entonces.

 Inicia con el salario que tiene como cocinera del colegio en Horquetas. Este  es el  segundo crédito que solicita, el anterior le permitió fortalecer su negocio y ahora requiere del mismo para diversificar su oferta de productos. 

  Ante la demanda de los clientes y la necesidad de ofrecer otros productos recurre a este préstamo para crecer y mejorar sus ingresos. Hay una importante demanda de zapatos, los cuales debe pagar en 22 días para mantener su crédito. Son zapatos de vestir y deportivos, para hombre y mujer, además vende ropa por catálogo y productos para el hogar. Dedica las mañanas a enviar sus hijos a la escuela y su trabajo en el comedor del colegio, por las tardes, de regreso a casa, vende sus productos y sale a cobrar, los fines de semana se desplaza a San José, donde compra la mercadería

 El negocio cuenta con una clientela creciente, ella vende en el colegio y en su comunidad a vecinos y familiares, a la fecha son 50 personas aproximadamente. Desea introducir la venta de zapatos pero para esto requiere capital, por lo cual solicita el préstamo. Tiene la clientela para colocarlo, pero la empresa proveedora no le da crédito a largo plazo. Este le va a permitir crecer y mejorar la oferta de productos de su microempresa.
texts.en:
Yanice Lorena is 38 years old and has two young children. In addition to managing her own business and taking care of her home, she has worked as a cook at the Environmental School in Horquetas, Costa Rica since 2010.

She started her business three years ago in order to build her savings and support her children in their studies.  Currently she lives with her children and her husband. She started with the salary she was making as a cook at the school in Horquetas.    Her previous loan helped her to develop and strengthen her business, which has been growing ever since. She repaid this loan punctually.

She is seeking this second loan so that she can diversify the products that she offers to her customers. This will enable her to meet her customer demand for new products, which will in turn help her to increase her income.  She has placed an important order for dress shoes and sports shoes for men and women.  She needs to pay the bill within 22 days in order to maintain her credit.

She also sells clothing and household products through catalogs.  She divides her time in the mornings between getting her children ready for school and working in the school dining hall.  In the afternoons, upon returning home, she sells products and collects payments from customers.  On the weekends, she travels to San José, where she buys merchandise.

Her business has a growing base of customers -- to date she has approximately 50 regular clients.  She sells her products at the school and in her community to neighbors and relatives.  She intends to introduce the sale of shoes, but this requires capital; thus she is seeking this loan.  She has customers that will buy these shoes, but her supplier has not given her credit on a long-term basis.  This loan will enable her to grow and improve her product offerings.

loans.use: to buy shoes for men, women and children, including dress shoes and sports shoes.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris 43, lives in Sinkor with her husband and three children, who range in age from 5 to 18 and are all in school. Doris was educated to the 12th grade.

Married to a driver, she has been selling frozen food including spare ribs, chickens, pig feet, and turkeys in the market for the past 18 years. Doris is proud of this business because the profits help her husband with the children's schooling, and she enjoys the interaction with her customers.

Now requesting her fifth loan to purchase more spare ribs, chickens, pig feet, and turkeys for the business, Doris' plan for the future is to continue to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more spare rib, chicken, pig feet, turkey for the business.

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is a 32-year-old hard-working and independent woman. She lives in Pakistan with her husband, two sons, and four daughters. One son is a police officer, and her husband is a taxi driver. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Samina is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. She is a tailor, and wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will buy a new taxi for her son, if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

Samina is a member of an eight-person group, and has requested a loan from KIVA partner, BRAC Pakistan. She plans to purchase a sewing machine to sew more dresses, and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She prays for her children's better future.

Her biggest dream in life is to go for an Umrah (pilgrimage). She is very much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy chicken, meat and other ingredients for her food production business.

NWTF is relisting Susan's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat and other ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar lives in Burastan village, Ararat region, with her husband and parents-in-law. Together with her family, Gohar runs a farm, where they keep cows and hens, and grow tomatoes, eggplants, peppers, and okra.

Considering high rate and number of diseases for plants, Gohar has to cultivate the land frequently with fertilizer to prevent the vegetables from developing diseases. Gohar has applied for this loan to purchase the necessary fertilizer. She also plans to buy one more cow and develop cattle breeding. This will allow Gohar to gather more milk, and get additional income from selling it.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and fertilizer.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
La señora Martina y su esposo el señor Efraín son un matrimonio estable y muy unido tiene dos hijos por los cuales tan luchando para salir a delante y poder darles lo mejor.
Están solicitan do un préstamo para la instalación eléctrica de su casa, porque la que tiene actualmente esta en malas condiciones y tiene miedo de que pueda pasar un accidente.
La señora Martina trabaja como cocinera en un puesta de tacos mañaneros, que son de guisados como (de carnitas, chorizo con huevo, picadillo, papas, frijoles, y mas variedad de guisados).  Con este sueldo planea pagar el crédito ya que su esposo el señor Efraín con el ingreso que obtiene como guardia de seguridad de una compañía será para pagar los gastos familiares y escolares de sus hijos.
Desean mejorar el patrimonio y vivir en una mejor condiciones y que sus hijos no corran con ningún peligró en su casa.
texts.en:
Martina and her husband Efraín have a stable marriage and are a very close-knit couple. They have two children, for whom they are striving to succeed, so that they can give them the best.

They are requesting a loan in order to upgrade the electrical wiring in their home, as what they currently have is in poor condition and they are afraid that an accident may happen.

Martina works as a cook in a breakfast taco stand. These are made with cooked fillings such as barbecued pork, sausage with egg, ground beef, potatoes, beans, and a variety of other fillings.  

With this income, she plans to pay off the loan, as her husband Efraín will use the income he gets as a company security guard, to pay the household expenses and their children's school costs.  

They wish to improve their personal asset, live in better conditions, and ensure that their children are not in danger in their home.

loans.use: To upgrade the electrical wiring in her home.

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es:
Dalila, originaria de Managua se dedica  atender una pulpería, casada, madre de 5 hijos, de los cuales ella mantiene a la menor que tiene 16 años de edad. Ella inicio su negocio por la necesidad de generar ingresos para apoyar a su esposo y además por la falta de empleo. Ella noto que las pulperías le ayudaban a generar ingresos más rápido  al mismo tiempo que le permitía está más cerca de sus hijos. Ella dice que le ha abierto el camino a conocer un poco más las necesidades de sus clientes, buscar mejores opciones en precios para productos así poder vender más accesible a las personas. Ella desea  introducir productos variados de mucha utilidad que le hagan un poco diferente de las pulperías es por ellos que desea vender literaturas. Por tal motivo está requiriendo el préstamo para comprar literaturas, granos básicos, productos de limpieza. 
Esto inversión le ayudara a emprender su venta de libros, tener más surtido el negocio y no dejar de atender las necesidades de sus clientes. Su meta es lograr impulsar la venta de libros y ampliar su pulpería en donde encuentra desde una aguja hasta un buen libro.
texts.en:
Dalila is a native of Managua and has a grocery store. She is married and has five children. She still takes care of her youngest child, who is 16 years old.  She started her business in order to help support her husband.  The lack of employment in the area was also a reason.  She says that her grocery stores have helped her generate income rapidly and at the same time have allowed her to be closer to her children.

She says that she has begun to better understand her customers' needs.  She is searching for better pricing options so that she will be able to sell her products at more accessible prices.

She wants to introduce a variety of very useful products that will make her stand out from the other stores.  For example, she wishes to start selling books.  Thus, she requires a loan in order to buy books, basic grains, and cleaning products.

This investment will help her to start selling books in her store, as well as to keep it more fully stocked so that she will not neglect the needs of her customers.  Her goal is to dive the sale of books and expand her store, in which one will find anything from a knitting needle to a good book.

loans.use: to buy books, basic grains, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Belky Dolores

texts.es:
La señora Belky de 25 años de edad es soltera se dedica desde hace 4 años a vender ropa nueva, vive en casa de sus padres con sus dos hijos en la comunidad de agua fría al sur de Honduras, en su negocio ella vende ropa para hombre, mujeres y  niños.
Belky el préstamo lo necesita para comprar ropa para niños, camisas, pantalones, blusas y calzonetas.  Ya que se acerca la época del día del niño y tiene varios pedidos de sus clientes es por tal razón que solicita   a prisma este crédito de 6,000.00 lempiras.
Belky Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende salir adelante y suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para su negocio.
Las metas de Belky es  hacer crecer su  negocio y vender cada día más para mejorar su calidad de vida.
San Lorenzo, Honduras – Agosto 2012
texts.en:
Belky, 25, is single.  She has sold new clothing for four years.  She lives in her parents' house with her two children in the community of Agua Fría in the south of Honduras.  In her business she sells clothing for men, women, and children.

Belky needs the loan to buy children's clothing, shirts, pants, blouses, and underwear.  Because the season of the Day of the Child is coming and she has several customer requests, she's asking Prisma for a loan for 6,000 lempiras [HNL].  With the help of the loan Belky hopes to get ahead and supplement her need for finances for her business.

Belky's goals are to make her business grow and to sell more every day to improve her quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras--August 2012

loans.use: to buy children's clothing, shirts, pants, blouses, and underwear

loans.name: One Word Organisation Group

texts.en:
Aminata is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Aminata was born in Segbema, near Koidu city in eastern Sierra Leone about 36 years ago. She is married to a businessman, and the couple have two children, who are attending primary and secondary schools. 

For over three years now, Aminata has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil in the country). This is the first loan that Aminata and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Aminata will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business.  She will buy palm oil at wholesale to add to her current stock. (Also included at right in the photo is Edward, the loan officer, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy palm oil at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 47-year-old married man. He has seven children, with ages ranging from 10 years to 22 years. He describes himself to be determined and visionary. 

He operates a farm  where he sells vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 15 years and employs one staff member. His business is located at a viable business area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a shortage of water for irrigation of his crops. 

He will use the KES 12,900 loan to buy a solar lamp that his family will use during the night.  His business goal is to improve his business within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

He hopes that in the future, he will start a business of selling milk to customers.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp for home use.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia solicita el préstamo para las instalaciones eléctricas de su casa ya que están en muy malas condiciones. 
La señora Silvia tiene poco tiempo que se separo de su esposo y fue quien se quedo con la responsabilidad de la familia y tiene dos hijos.
La señora Silvia trabaja en una compañía de guardia de seguridad  con este sueldo pagara el crédito, ya que sus dos hijos se encargaran de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo.
Lo que quieren es mejorar su patrimonio, que este más seguro y en buenas condiciones.
La señora Silvia espera contar con su cooperación en este crédito ya que anterior mente ha tenido préstamos con KIVA el cual le ha servido para salir adelante y superar a su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia is requesting the loan in order to upgrade the electrical wiring in her home, as it is in very poor condition. 

Silvia separated from her husband a short time ago, and she was the one left with responsibility for the family. She has two children. 

Silvia works at a security guard company. With these earnings she will pay off the loan, as her two children look after the household expenses with the income they get from their work.  

What they want is to improve their major personal asset, so that it is safer and in good repair.

Silvia is hoping for your cooperation in this loan, as she has previously had loans with Kiva that have enabled her to move forward in life and better her family's situation.

loans.use: To upgrade the electrical wiring in her home.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María, de 57 años de edad, de oficio comerciante, madre de 5 hijos, habita en la ciudad de Managua. Es dueña de una venta comida, refrescos  también de una pequeña pulpería. Ella inicio vendiendo gaseosas, galletas, dulces. Fue ahorrando para poder comprar otro tipos de productos que sus mismos clientes le solicitaban así fue como formo la pequeña pulpería. Después decidió también invertir en la venta de comida aprovechando su habilidad en la cocina esta actividad la realiza por las noches mientras una sus hijas le ayuda con la pulpería. Su tiempo lo divide en estas  2 actividades   que empieza desde muy tempranas horas y finaliza alrededor de las 10 de la noche cuando termina de vender comida.  
Ella requiere el financiamiento para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, plátanos, verduras, frutas, empaques para comida. Esto le ayudara a invertir en productos para su pulpería y comideria. Su proyecto es tener establecido y con mejores condiciones su negocio de comideria y ampliar más su pulpería, pues la comodidad para sus clientes es primordial para ella ya que de ellos se mantiene su negocio.
texts.en:
María is 57 years old, a business woman and mother of five children who lives in the city of Managua. She is the owner of a food stand, and sells drinks too in a small grocery store. She started out selling soft drinks, cookies and sweets. She was saving in order to buy other types of products that her customers themselves asked for and this is how the little store got its start.

Later she decided to invest also in the sale of food taking advantage of her competence in the kitchen. She does this work in the evenings while one of her daughters helps with the grocery store. She divides her time between these two activities that she begins in the early morning hours and finishes at around 10:00PM in the evening when she finishes selling food.

She needs financing to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, bananas, vegetables, fruit, and packaging for the meals. This will help her invest in products for her grocery store and food stand. Her plan is to be established with improved conditions for her food stand and to expand her grocery store because the convenience for her customers is of prime importance to her because they are keeping her in business.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, bananas, vegetables, fruit, and packaging for her dishes

loans.name: Cate's Group

texts.en:
Cate's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Cate is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Cate has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells fresh food like matooke. 

To help expand her business, Cate has requested a loan of 350,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy  more fresh food like matooke and maize for resale.   It will help Cate to generate greater profits and improve her business by adding more types of fresh food like cassava. Cate hopes that in the future she will be able to improve her family's standard of living. 

Cate is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy  more fresh food like matooke and maize for resale.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is married with one child, and her only child goes to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (old parents). 

She has a business of tailoring, and she has been in this business for seven years.  She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials and threads.  She generates additional income through knitting table clothes.  She works from her home and works seven days a week and sells on retail only. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. 

She aspires to own a tailoring school and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house; the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials and threads

loans.name: Consuelo Del Socorro

texts.es: Consuelo, de 36 años de edad , tiene 2 hijos  de  13 y 6 años de edad respectivamente , casada originaria de Managua. Inicio su negocio cuando fue despedida de su trabajo, con la liquidación que le dieron tomo la decisión junto con su esposo de emprender un negocio que le ayudara a solventar los gastos económicos, entonces surgió la idea de poner una pulpería, vio la necesidad de invertir  en más mercadería para vender, fue cuando busco la ayuda de financiamiento pues no tenía suficiente capital. Su esposo trabaja con los ingresos que obtiene como conductor le ayuda con los gastos de su hogar. Ella necesita invertir en compra de granos básicos, aceite, jugos, gaseosas, productos lácteos, detergentes, jabón, recargas de teléfonos, snacks. Su sueño es lograr ampliar mas su pulpería y comprar un pequeño local para vender comida, para diversificar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Consuelo is a married 36-year-old woman from Managua with two children who are aged 6 and 13.  Her husband works as a driver, and he helps her with the household expenses. 

She started her business when she lost her job.  With the severance that they gave her, she made the decision together with her husband to start a business that would help with the household expenses.  They then had the idea to open a grocery store.  She saw the necessity to invest in more merchandise to sell.  It was then that she sought a loan since she did not have sufficient capital.

She needs to to buy basic grains, oil, juices, soft drinks, dairy products, soap, phone cards and snacks.  Her dream is to be able to grow her store more and buy a small permanent store where she can sell food in order to diversify her income and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, juices, soft drinks, dairy products, soap, phone cards and snacks.

loans.name: Jaime Ernesto

texts.es:
JAIME ERNESTO tiene 29 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en la ciudad de Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

Jaime Ernesto tiene una panadería, además en los tiempos libres se dedica a realizar construcciones de vivienda.
Solicita el crédito para comprar harina, queso, cilindros de gas.

 Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar la mercadería que tanta falta le hace para poder realizar el pan para vender. 

El desafío al que se enfrenta es ahorrar y comprar una casa. El Sueño es poder salir adelante con la familia. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Jaime Ernesto is 29 years old, married, has two children and lives with his wife and children in the city of Guaranda in the province of Bolívar. 

Jaime Ernesto has a bakery, and in his free time he works in housing construction.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy flour, cheese, and gas cylinders. With the help of a loan he could buy the supplies that he needs in order to make the bread to sell.

The challenge that he faces is to save in order to buy a house. His dream is  for his family to get ahead. In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy flour, cheese, and gas cylinders so that he will have what he needs to bake bread to sell in his bakery

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en:
For cultural reasons, Fatimah prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Fatimah is a 53-year-old married female from Al Koorah in Jordan.  She has two children and requested a JOD 300 loan to pay for her home improvements. In the future, she would like to buy some electronic devices and bedroom furniture.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina, de 44 años, es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Cesar de 46 años y sus 05 queridos hijos a quienes desea brinda una mejor calidad de vida. Alejandrina, es una mujer perseverante y luchadora, se dedica a la venta de abonos natural y estiércol; gracias al esfuerzo de seguir adelante, hoy, cuenta con su negocio donde atiende con mucha alegría para los pobladores de la comunidad; Alejandrina, logra vender sus productos a los agricultores que siempre están al tanto de sus cultivos y piden consejo a la señora Alejandrina para que les apoye como poder mantener sanos sus siembras. Sin embargo le consta que también hay dificultades al no poder tener los abonos naturales para la gente agricultora que requiere. Por ende acude a MFP para solicitar un préstamo y de esa forma pueda abastecerse de sus productos. Este es su crédito número 02, se compromete a pagar de forma puntual sus cuotas, para que en otra oportunidad logre acceder a otro. En su banco comunal es una socia alegre y responsable.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará sacos de abonos naturales par su venta.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 44 years old. She is a hard working, responsible woman. She lives in her own house with her 46 year old husband, Cesar, and her five dear children for whom she wants to give a better quality of life.

Alejandrina is a tenacious woman and a go-getter. She works selling natural fertilizers and manure. Thanks to her efforts she is getting ahead. Today in her business she attends to the people of the community with much happiness. Alejandrina manages to sell her products to the farmers who are always caring for their crops and they ask Alejandrina for advice and she helps them so they can keep their crops healthy.

However, for the record, there are difficulties too in not being able to have the natural fertilizer that the farming people need. This is why she came to the MFP office to ask for a loan so that she can supply them with their products.

This is her second loan. She agrees to make timely payments so that at another opportunity she will attain another. In her communal bank she is a happy and trustworthy member.

With the 1,000 soles, she will buy bags of natural fertilizer to sell.

loans.use: to buy bags of natural fertilizer to sell to the farmers as she advises them about caring for their crops

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento SOL NACIENTE está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón,   la presidenta del  banco es la Sra.  Ana tiene 29 años, es casada tiene dos  hijos de las edades de 7 y 1 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de San Jose,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Ana  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de de insumos como arroz, fideo y papa por mayor  para la elaboración de sus platillos  y  de esta manera brindar variedad de platillos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Ana va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, La Sra. Ana es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras del grupo ya que en muchos casos son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The communal bank "Rising Sun" is made up of eight members, seven women and one man. The president of the bank is Sra. Ana. She is 29 years old, married, and has two children of 7 and one year of age. She works selling food at her food stall that is located in the community of San Jose. This is her second loan with the institution. Sra. Ana is going to use this loan to purchase wholesale goods like rice, noodles and potatoes to make her dishes and thus be able to better serve her clients. Her reason for asking for the loan is to be able to continue improving in her business. She will use the benefits of the loan to continue purchasing ingredients and gain more money. Ana is a very hard working person and feels happy for the opportunity given to her since her fellow group members in many cases are working alone to get their families ahead.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale rice, noodles, and potatoes

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Renacer es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, donde las 19 miembros son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad.  Gracias a la unión que demuestran están saliendo adelante y se ayudan las unas a las otras.
Florencia es la presidenta del grupo, ella cuenta que su grupo siempre se esfuerza por sobresalir y también tratan de ayudar a su comunidad en todo lo que pueden. Florencia vende perfumes de la marca Avon, que trae sobre pedido y luego sus clientes le pagan, comenta que siempre tiene buena venta y pedidos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes, con lo que podrá cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Renacer is from the city of Caaguazú. The 19 members are fiends and residents of the city. Thanks to their unity they are getting ahead and helping each other. 

Florencia is the president of the group. She says that the group always strives to get ahead and also help in their community as much as they can.   Florencia sells Avon perfume. She fills orders and later her customers pay her. She says she always has good sales and orders. She is asking for the loan to buy perfume so that she can fill some customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy perfume to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Las 18  integrantes del grupo son de la ciudad de Caacupé, el grupo lleva por nombre MUJERES UNIDAS, ya que ellas son unidas y se esfuerzan por salir adelante y dar a sus familias todo lo que necesitan para una mejor vida.
SE unieron con el propósito de salir de la pobreza y darle una buena educación a sus hijos y que no tengan que pasar por ninguna necesidad. Maria es la presidenta, ella vende perfumes de todas las marcas, para hombres y mujeres, tiene muy buena clientela y sobre todo esta siempre con muchos pedidos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes para damas y caballeros, con lo cual podrá seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The 18 members of this group are from the city of Caacupé. The group’s name is Mujeres unidas because they are united and they strive to move forward and to provide to their families everything they need for a better life. 

They are joined in their effort to escape poverty and to provide a quality education to their children such that they do not have to suffer any deprivations.

Maria is the president. She sells perfumes of all brands for both men and women. She has very good customers and above all she always has many orders. 

She is asking for this loan to purchase perfumes for men and women. With this she will be able to meet her clients’ demands.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes for men and women for sale.

loans.name: Aravoi Group

texts.es:
Aravoi tiene 10 mujeres como integrantes, ellas se unieron al programa de la fundacion, ya que vieron una gran ayuda y progreso no solo para ellas, sino también para sus familias.
Se esfuerzan por salir adelante y por medio de su trabajo tener los ingresos necesarios para dar a sus familias e hijos todo lo que necesitan.  Maria se dedica a la olería, hacen ladrillos y otro tipo de cerámica, con lo cual salen adelante ella y su familia. Solicita este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de arcilla, que es el producto esencial  para seguir haciendo sus ladrillos.
Maria y su grupo agradecen por la ayuda que reciben de Kiva y fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
Aravoi has ten female members. They are united in the program of Fundación because they saw the great help and progress they could achieve not only for themselves but also for their families. 

They strive to get by and through their work they have the necessary income to provide their families and children with everything they need. 

Maria works in a pottery which produces bricks and other ceramics. This helps her and her family move forward. 

She is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of clay which is the necessary ingredient to continue making the bricks. 

Maria and her group are grateful for the help they are receiving from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to purchase clay for bricks.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
MARIANA DE JESUS tiene 21 años de edad es madre soltera tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
	
MARIANA DE JESUS trabaja de recepcionista en un Hotel. Solicita el crédito para poder pagar la matrícula, comprar libros y cuadernos.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá matricularse y comprar los libros que le hacen falta para la universidad.

La inscripción de la matrícula lo hará en la ciudad de Guaranda. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es realizar un viaje largo en barco, El sueño es poder culminar los estudios. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Mariana de Jesus is 21 years old, a single mother with a son, and lives with her son in Guaranda, in the province of Bolívar. Mariana de Jesus works as a receptionist in a hotel. 

She is asking for a loan in order to pay tuition, to buy books and notebooks. With the help of the loan she could register and buy the books that she needs for university. Registration to enroll takes place in Guaranda. The challenges she faces is a long trip by boat. 

Her dream is to be able to finish her studies. In her free time she likes to listen to music.

loans.use: to pay tuition, and to buy the books and notebooks that she needs for university

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared, 45 years old, is married and has 2 children, 15 and 21 years old. He describes himself as hardworking. Jared operates a retail store where he sells electronics goods. He has been involved in this business for 14 years and employs 5 staff members. His business is located in a viable business area and his primary customers are local residents. Jared describes his biggest business challenge to be low purchasing power from the customers.

Jared will use this KES 12,900 loan to buy a solar lamp which will be used by his family members during the night. His goal is to improve his business which will be famous within 5 years. Jared hopes that, in the future, he will expand his business. This is his fifth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita, 37, lives with her husband and two children, aged 10 and 14, in Sinkor. She has been involved in her business for the past four years and has a table in the market, where she sells ladies' dresses and blouses and men's shirts. Rita learned to sell from her mother, and her husband helped her with the initial capital to start this business. Her favorite part of the business is meeting new customers. Rita faces the challenge of low sales during the rainy season. She will use the profit generated from the business to buy more goods and to contribute to the household expenses. Rita is requesting this loan to purchase more used clothes for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Meswalehe

texts.en:
Meswalehe, 36, lives with her common-law spouse and her four children in a suburban neighborhood in Mombasa. She has her own business selling food at the market. Meswalehe works hard all day to earn income needed for her family’s daily sustenance.

Meswalehe is asking Yehu for her third loan of KES 35,000 to purchase flour, cooking oil, charcoal, beans, etc. Her goal is to see that her business remains stable in order to increase her income and to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cooking oil, charcoal, beans, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds to raise.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a resident of Nkubu in central Kenya, where she lives with her family of two children, aged 13 and 7 years. She is 38 years old and has nine years of experience in farming. She currently produces maize and beans and runs her farm with one farmhand.

Lucy has requested a loan of KES 60,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank and irrigation pipes. She says this will enable her diversify her farming business and earn better income, which she will channel to the education of her children. She aspires to own residential houses.

Lucy says Juhudi Kilimo services have been of great help to smallholder farmers, but points out that poor local markets and inadequate rain are the challenges farmers face.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Juan Miguel

texts.es:
JUAN MIGUEL tiene 40 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los dos hijos en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia de Bolívra.

Juan Miguel presta sus servicios cómo guardia de seguridad en una institución pública. Solicita el crédito para comprar libros, cuadernos, lonchera, zapatos, uniforme. Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Gauarnda.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los útiles escolares, uniformes, zapatos para que los hijos puedan asistir a las clases. 

El sueño es poder comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ambato. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es poder dar el estudio a los hijos.
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbool.
texts.en:
Juan Miguel is a 40-year-old married father of two children. He lives with his wife and two children in the city of Guaranda, in the Bolívra province.

Juan Miguel works as a security guard at a public institute. He is requesting this loan in order to purchase books, notebooks, lunchboxes, shoes, and uniforms. He will make the purchases in the city of Guaranda.

With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy the school supplies, uniforms, and shoes that his children need to attend school.

His dream is to be able to purchase a house in the city of Ambato. One of the challenges he faces is being able to provide his children with an education.

In his free time, he likes to play soccer.

loans.use: to purchase books, notebooks, lunchboxes, shoes, and uniforms.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es: Olga, tiene 39 años de edad, casada, tiene 5 hijos y vive en el municipio de Villanueva, Cortes. Olga  tiene su propio negocio de venta de productos alimenticios  como ser: granos básicos, embutidos, pan, carnes, refrescos, azúcar, churros, jugos, café etc. este negocio tiene 10 meses de funcionar y ya tiene buena clientela. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. El préstamo que solicita es por 6,000 Lempiras y es el segundo ciclo, con el cual va surtir la pulpería de productos alimenticios de consumo diario, con el objetivo de mantener siempre activo su negocio. Su plan de seguir trabajando es mantener estable el negocio y bien surtido que le genere los ingresos necesarios para su familia.
texts.en:
Olga, 39, is married and has five children; she lives in Villanueva, Cortes.  Olga has her own business selling food products like basic grains, canned goods, bread, meat, soft-drinks, sugar, packaged snacks, juice, coffee, etc.  The business has been in operation ten months and already has a good clientele.  She’s always worked in commerce.

She’s asking for a 6,000 Lempira loan and this is her second cycle.  She will use it to stock her grocery store with food items that are consumed every day.  Her objective is to always keep her business active.  Her plan for continuing working is to keep the business stable and well-stocked so that it will generate the income necessary for her family.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items to stock her grocery store..

loans.name: Rubi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RUBI” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Luisa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de polleras y mantas, pastelería, venta de cosméticos, productos de belleza, venta de ropa usada, venta de joyas y material de plata.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Luisa es una integrante, ella indica que hace ocho ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su hermana que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa interior, ella nos cuenta que desde niña ella trabajó con su madre vendiendo ropa interior, es por esta razón que inicio su propio negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa interior) que comprará de las vendedoras por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará de forma ambulante en las ferias de la cuidad de La Paz. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank Rubi is beginning its eighth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación. It has eight members and is headed by a board with Luisa as the President. The businesses that the communal bank members have are varied and among them are: clothing sales, sales of skirts and ponchos, bakery, cosmetic sales, beauty products, used clothing, silver goods and jewelry.

The loan that they are taking will benefit small micro entrepreneurs where Luisa is a member. She says that she has eight cycles with Pro Mujer, joining through the invitation of her sister who is a member of the institution. Today she has a business selling underclothing. She tells us that as a child she worked with her mother selling underclothing, which is why she began her own business.

The loan that she is asking for now is to increase her capital (to buy underclothing) that she will buy from the wholesalers and then later she will sell them as a traveling salesperson in the markets in the city of La Paz. This way of working allows her to earn income to support her family as much as possible. She lives in a free union relationship and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the loan and health training.

loans.use: to buy underclothing from wholesalers to sell in her business as a traveling salesperson in the markets of La Paz

loans.name: Romel Edison

texts.es:
ROMEL EDISON tiene 24 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la madre en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 
 Romel Edison se dedica a la venta de pinchos. Solicita el crédito para pagar la matrícula, comprar cuadernos.

 Con la ayuda del crédito podrá pagar la matrícula, comprar  lo neceesario para poder asistir a la universidad. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la falta de dinero para culminar los estudios. La matrícula lo hara en la universidad y las compras lo hara en la ciudad de Guaranda.

El sueño es poder culminar los estudios y trabajar. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a distraerce por el parque vendiendo.
texts.en:
Romel Edison is 24 years old, a bachelor and has no children. He lives with his mother in the city of Guaranda in Bolivar Province. Romel Edison sells kebabs. He is requesting a loan to pay his registration fees and to buy books.

With help from the loan he will be able to pay to register and buy all that he needs to attend the university. The challenge that he faces is the lack of money to finish his studies. He will pay his registration fees at the university and he will buy his books in the city of Guaranda. 

His dream is to finish his studies and work. In his spare time he enjoys going to the park to amuse himself and to sell kebabs.

loans.use: to pay his university registration fees and buy books.

loans.name: El Manantial (Ganadería) Group

texts.es: El Grupo Manantial se encuentra en una comunidad muy tranquila donde las personas se caracterizan por ser humildes y muy sencilla pero sobre todo siempre muy respetuosa el grupo está conformado por 6 mujeres muy trabajadoras que además de sus tareas domesticas son mujeres emprendedoras ya que cada una de ellas tiene una actividad productiva como es por eso que están solicitando el crédito a la institución como por ejemplo las señoras Paulina, Elvira, Gloria, Romualda, compraran borregos para cría y engorda para que en un futuro puedan vender mientras que doña María invertirá en productos lácteos para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, las integrantes del grupo no saben porque se llama así el grupo ya que las personas que iniciaron el grupo ya no están trabajando con la institución sin embargo ellas creen que el nombre lo eligieron porque en la comunidad donde viven existen varios manantiales que son de gran ayuda a la población cuando en su comunidad no hay agua potable, Doña Elvira es una integrante del grupo manantial nos platica que tiene 33 años de edad está casada con el señor Melquiades desde hace 15 años juntos han formado una familia con 6 niños los cuales tres de ellos asisten a la escuela de la comunidad Doña Elvira argumenta “Siempre he vivido en la comunidad y desde pequeña he visto todas las costumbres que se tienen en la comunidad como los platillos que se comen, las fiestas que se celebran, la vestimenta típica, lo que se cultiva, lo que se cría y también a través de los años he visto como se van quedando en el olvido de todo esto a lo que veo y he aprendido de mi comunidad es criar animales como los borregos en casa tengo 3 borregos pero pienso comprar 5 borregos mas y pastura la actividad la inicie ya individualmente hace 5 años quien me ayudo mucho para tener éxito en mi actividad fue mi suegra ya que fue me enseño tips importantes para lograr mi éxito. La única dificultad que presento algunas es la falta de información para cuidar mejor a mis borregos ya que muchas veces enferman y mueren si me gustaría capacitarme para saber qué hacer en esta cuestión esta vez con el crédito voy a comprar madera para mejorar y hacer más grande el corral de mis borregos porque solo tengo tres y si compro los cinco borregos mas ya no van a caber y van a estar muy incómodos todos juntos, mis borregos los compro desde chicos para crecerlos y engordarlos para después venderlos a un mejor precio porque entre más grandes y gordos estén mejor es la paga, para lograr  todo esto por las mañanas les limpio el corral donde duermen después les doy de comer zacate seco y les pongo su agua para cuando se les ofrezca y por la tarde después de que mis hijos regresan de la escuela les voy de comer y nos  vamos todos a pastar a mis borregos al llano es lo que más me gusta porque ahí mis hijos juegan futbol se divierten mucho así yo cuido de mis borregos y de mis hijos” cuando le cuestionamos cual era su meta sonriendo nos dijo “Arreglar mi casa ya no quiero que goteé como coladera ya que cuando llueve se moja mucho y no se cómo controlar la goteadera y para mis hijos quiero que terminen una carrera profesional”.
texts.en:
The ‘Manatial” [Spring] group is in a very peaceful community where the people are known for being humble and very unassuming.  Above all, the group is always very respectful.  It is comprised of six very hard-working women, who, in addition to their household chores, are entrepreneurs.  Each one of them has a productive business activity.

That is why they are requesting a loan from the institution.  For example, Paulina, Elvira, Gloria, and Romualda buy sheep to raise and fatten.  They are later able to sell them.  María will invest in dairy products to stock her grocery store.

The group members do not know why its name was chosen.  The people who started the group are no longer working with the institution.  Nevertheless, they believe that it is because the place where they live has many small springs.  These are very helpful to the inhabitants when their community does not have potable water.

Elvira is a member of the Manantial group.  She tells us that she is 33 years old, and she has been married to Melquiades for 15 years.  Together they have formed a family with six children, three of whom go to the community school.  Elvira explains, “I have always lived in the community.  Ever since I was little I have seen all of the community’s customs like the dishes that are eaten, the holidays that are celebrated, the typical clothing, what is grown, and what is raised.  Also, through the years I have seen how all of this is being forgotten.  What I have learned from my community is raising animals like the sheep that I have at home.  I have three sheep, but I am thinking of buying five more and fodder.  I started this business activity individually five years ago.  The person who helped me a lot to be successful in my business activity was my mother-in-law.  She taught me important tips in order to be successful.  The only difficulty I encountered is the lack of information about how to take better care of my sheep.  Many times they get sick and die.  I would like to get training in order to know about this issue.

This time I will use the loan to buy wood to improve and enlarge the sheep corral.  I only have three, and if I buy five more sheep, they will not fit.  All of them together will be very uncomfortable.  I bought my sheep when they were little in order for them to grow and fatten so that I could later sell them for a better price.  When they are bigger and fatter, the pay is better.  In order to achieve all of this, in the mornings I clean the corral where they sleep.  After that I give them dried grass to eat, and I provide them with water. 

In the afternoon, after my children get home from school, I feed them.  Then we all go to the plains for my sheep to graze.  This is what I like the best because my children play soccer there, and they have a lot of fun.  This way I take care of my sheep and my children.”  When we asked her what her goal is, she smiled and said, “Fixing my house because I don’t want it to leak like a sieve.  When it rains it gets very wet, I do not know how to control the leaking.  My goal for my children is for them to complete their studies, and earn a professional degree."

loans.use: to buy wood to improve and enlarge the sheep corral.

loans.name: Cesar Manuel

texts.es:
Cesar Manuel tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero, y vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida junto a su madre.
El es una persona emprendedora, desde hace 4 años se dedica a vender  chicharrones de soya en bolsitas en ristras, también vende  especies y condimentos (cominos, pimiento, canela, ajo, etc.) tajadas de plátano y sorpresas (confites con un juguetito para niños). Además siempre vende helados en vasitos. Distribuye sus productos de manera ambulante transportándose en bicicleta. Al negocio le dedica todo el día ya que compra el producto, lo prepara en bolsitas y ristra y lo vende. Va por el cuarto ciclo de préstamo, actualmente solicita 9,000 Lempiras, que lo utilizara para seguir surtiendo de materia prima como: chicharrones, especies, condimentos, juguetes, y otros insumos para su negocio. Su meta es seguir creciendo con el negocio para tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Cesar Manuel, 29, is single and lives in Tela, Atlántida with his mother.  He’s an enterprising person who has been selling soy ‘chicharrones’ [imitation pork rinds] packaged in strips of little bags.  He also sells spices and condiments (cumin, pepper, cinnamon, garlic, etc.); fried banana strips and surprises (sweets for children with a surprise toy inside).  He also sells ice-cream in small glasses.  He sells from place to place getting around on a bicycle.  He works all day in his business because he buys the product, prepares the little bags, arranges them in strips and sells them.

He’s starting his fourth loan cycle and this time is asking for a 9,000 Lempira loan that he’ll use to continue stocking up on raw materials like “chicharrones,” spices, condiments, toys and other supplies for his business.  His goal is to continue growing with the business in order to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy "chicharrones," suprises (little toys for children), condiments and spices to package and sell in strips.

loans.name: Marjorie Alicia

texts.es:
MARJORIE ALICIA tiene 33 años de edad es soletra no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Ventannas provincia de los ríos.

MARJORIE ALICIA presta los servicios en algunas casas de la región. Solicita el crédito para comprar muebles, y una computadora. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que tanta falta le hace. Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de guaranda.

El sueño es poder comprar una casa. los desfíos a los que se enfrenta es poder seguir trabajando. En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar.
texts.en: Marjorie Alicia, 33, is single and has no children; she lives with her parents in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She provides service in local houses and is asking for the loan to buy furniture and a computer.  With help from the loan she’ll be able to buy what she so needs.  She will make her purchases in the city of Guaranda.  Her dream is to be able to buy a house and the challenge she faces is to be able to continue working.  In her free time she likes to rest.

loans.use: to buy furniture and a computer.

loans.name: Yesit

texts.es:
Yesit, es soltero pero tiene dos hijos; vive en una casa alquilada ocupando tres habitaciones con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Villa Alemania de la ciudad de El Alto.

Yesit, estudió hasta secundaria  y actualmente es socio en una línea de trufis y trabaja como chofer asalariado en el área del transporte público por más de ocho horas al día, de esta forma él cubre los gastos de alimentación, médicos, pago de  alquiler y otros servicios básicos.

El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento general de la movilidad  de su propiedad (cambio de aceites, chequeo de frenos, balanceo de llantas) para prestar un buen servicio a sus pasajeros y mejorar sus ingresos ya que es su única fuente de trabajo.

El sueño de Yesit, es tener su casa propia para mejorar su calidad de vida y dar más comodidad a su familia.
Es la cuarta vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Yesit is single but has two children.  He lives in a rented, three-bedroom house with adobe walls and dirt floor located in the city of El Alto’s Villa Alemania zone.  Yesit studied up to secondary school and is currently a partner in a cooperative taxi line working as a salaried driver providing public transportation service for more than 8 hours daily.  This is how he pays for food, medical expenses, rent and other basic services.

He needs the loan to provide general service for his car (oil change, break check, tire balancing) to provide good customer service and improve his income since this is his only source of income.  Yesit’s dream is to own a house to improve his quality of life and provide more comfort for his family.  This is the fourth time he’s worked with IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to service his car.

loans.name: Wilma Eulalia

texts.es: La Sra. Wilma tiene 37 años y es casada con 4 hijos que son de las edades de 21, 17, 14 y 10,  ella se dedica al comercio de chuño, tunta y kaya estos son cereales deshidratados, su tienda se encuentra en la zona de  Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Wilma  va a usar este préstamo de para compra por cargas tunta papa chuño y caya por su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo ya que esta época de fin de año tiene mucha venta, la Sra. Wilma enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, ella va a utilizar los beneficios es seguir incrementando su mercadería, la Sra. Wilma es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Wilma is 37 years old, married, and has four children, who are ages 21, 17, 14 and 10. Wilma makes a living selling dry crops and grains, including: chuño (a species of potato), tunta (a white, potato-like root), and caya. Her store is located in the Achachicala district in the city of La Paz. This is her third loan with this institution, and Wilma plans to use the support from the loan to purchase dry grains in bulk to stock her business, as sales tend to increase toward the end of the year. 

The most significant challenge Wilma faces in operating her business is competition. Wilma is a very hardworking person, and is grateful for this opportunity. She hopes that the benefits from this loan and investment will help her to increase her stock of merchandise and strengthen her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of dry grains to stock her business.

loans.name: Ledis

texts.es: Cervezas, dulces y productos d e panaderías fue lo que compró Ledis con su anterior credikiva, con el que se fortaleció, aumentando su capital de trabajo, surtió muy bien y satisfizo las necesidades de su clientela. Hoy está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento y con el planea continuar aumentando sus ingresos aumentando sus ventas, porque agregará a sus oferta nuevos productos de tocador, así es que comprará  refrescos y bebidas, derivados de la harina de trigo, y productos de tocador. Ella agradece mucho por la ayuda de Kiva y por esa maravillosa labor que están haciendo.
texts.en: Beer, sweets, and baked goods are the products that Ledis purchased with her previous Kiva loan. With the loan, she strengthened her business by increasing her working capital, so she was able to restock her shop well and meet her customer's needs. She is now requesting a new loan with which she plans to keep increasing her income by increasing sales, since she will now offer personal care products for sale. She will purchase liquor, soft drinks, wheat products, and personal care products. She is very grateful for Kiva's help and for the wonderful work that they are doing.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, liquor, wheat products, and personal care products.

loans.name: Rieles Group

texts.es: El grupo “Rieles” está conformado por dos mujeres y un hombre los integrantes son familiares  y el nombre del grupo lo eligieron precisamente por eso pero también porque el lujar donde ellos viven están unos Rieles que es por donde pasaban el transporte pero con el tiempo desapareció nos platica Don Felipe que empezaron a construir encima de esos rieles y ahora ya solo se alcanza a apreciar una parte de los rieles, Don Felipe quien es el represente nos platica que tiene 54 años de edad, solo estudio hasta cuarto grado de primaria se caso con la señora María juntos formaron una familia hijos pero por el momento solo tienen un hijo que se encuentra estudiando y una nieta que también está  a su cargo, Don Felipe nos platica “Yo me dedico a la cría de animales por el momento solo tengo siete cerdos y dos reces en la actividad tengo ya 17 años de experiencia, inicie mi negocio porque tenía que obtener otra entrada de dinero aunque trabajo como obrero muchas veces la familia necesita otras cosas y es por eso que me decidí criar animales ya que es una actividad muy buena que se puede desarrollar muy bien en la comunidad, pero también inicie porque tenía un amigo que me invito a criar animales y me motivo mucho porque desde al principio me ofreció una tanda de cerdos que tenia para mí y se  acepte y así fue como empecé a criar animales, es por eso que estoy solicitando un nuevo crédito con la institución para comprar alimento para cerdos para engordar a sus cerdos, es una dificultad por la cual estoy atravesando la falta de dinero para comprar más alimento pero gracias al crédito el podre comprar el alimento, hace tiempo yo llegue  a tener  cerdas grandes que podían darme hasta 25 lechones (cerdos chicos)  me iba muy bien sin embargo un buen día me invitaron para hacerme cargo del puesto de delegado el cual acepte pero absorbía mucho mi tiempo y fue cuando empecé a tener problemas con mis animales, dos cerdas que estaban a punto de parir perdieron todos sus lechones por salta de atención, llegue a perder 50 lechones en un mismo día, si mis cerdos que tengo en casa y mis reces crecen en muy poco tiempo podre vender mis cerdos a muy buen precio con atención y que estén muy bien alimentados en cuatro meses podre recuperarme en la misma cantidad, quiero que mis animales crezcan y siga yo teniendo mucho más para que mis hijos puedan seguir estudiando ya que deseo que ellos terminen una carrera donde puedan realizarse profesionalmente.”  Don Felipe es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable lo único que quiere es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Doña María y Celia forman parte del grupo quienes también se dedican e invertirán en los animales que tiene Don Felipe ya que es una actividad compartida.
texts.en:
The “Rieles” group is two women and one man; they are all related to each other and they chose the group name precisely because of that but also because there are some railroad tracks in the place where they live left over from the time in the past when trains which have since disappeared passed by here.  Construction started to happen on top of the tracks and now just parts of them are still visible.

Felipe is the group representative and he relates that he’s 54-years-old and only studied up to fourth grade in elementary school.  He married María and they formed a family and had children.  Currently, though, they only have one son left at home who is attending school and a granddaughter who is also in their care.
