texts.es: Miguel es un agricultor de la zona de Huatusco, Ver. Cuenta con 56 años de edad vive en casa propia y es soltero, cultiva café desde hace ya mucho tiempo pues desde niño su padre le enseño todo lo relacionado con el oficio, es productor de café orgánico el cual vende a la Unión Regional de Huatusco. Miguel también trabaja por temporadas como jornalero con otras personas para así tener un ingreso extra. Para Miguel sus padres son lo más importante. Lo que mas quiere es ayudarlos a salir adelante. Por lo cual ha decidido pedir un crédito para mejorar su finca de café con la compra de fertilizantes, compra de plantas para renovación y para el pago de labores culturales de manera que con ello se pueda obtener una buena cosecha que hará posible que mejore sus ingresos así como también su calidad de vida. A él le gustaría pasando la cosecha remodelar su casa para que sus padres vivan más cómodamente.
texts.en: Miguel is a farmer in the Huatusco, Veracruz area. He is 56 years old. He lives in his own house and is single. He has grown coffee for quite a long time, since from childhood his father taught him everything about this work. He produces organic coffee that he sells to the regional union of Huatusco. Miguel also works seasonally as a day laborer with other people to thus have an extra income. For Miguel, his parents are the most important thing. What he most wants is to help them advance. For this reason, he has decided to apply for a loan to improve his coffee farm with the purchase of fertilizers, to buy plants for renovation, and to pay for labor to care for the plants so that he can obtain a good harvest that will make it possible to improve his income as well as his quality of life. After the harvest, he would like to remodel his house so that his parents can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and fertilize his farm

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is 41 years old and has six children. She and her husband live with them in the town of Likoni, Mombasa. Biasha has her own business selling fish. She has a location in one of the busy areas of the market. She tells us that she is well known since she has been in this business for over 10 years and her customers call her mama samaki (mother who sells fish). This experience has earned good profits for her from her ever-increasing customers. 

The loan she is requesting now is her fourth one and is for 30,000 KES. The money will be used to buy more stock of fish and cooking oil so she can increase her earnings. Biasha’s dream is to have a strong business that will generate income so that she can cover her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more fish and cooking oil

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, 37, is from Ndunyu-Njeru and is married with three children who are between the ages of 8 and 14.

Stephen is a cobbler and has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy leather which he can use to make shoes for sale.

He hopes to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy leather to make shoes.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es: Benjamin de 52 años de edad tiene una tienda donde vende ranchos, víveres, refrescos y en general artículos de la canasta familiar, en pequeñas proporciones que su clientela puede comprar. El y su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 13 a 25 años, vive al suroccidente de la ciudad, en un barrio que poco a poco sale de la informalidad de sus habitantes, quienes son principalmente trabajadores independientes, con grandes sueños de salir adelante, mediante la educación de su familia.  En la actualidad necesita surtir su negocio porque la demanda de los artículos que ofrece crece cada día más y sus inventarios no resisten tanta solicitud, por su insuficiente capital de trabajo para responderles y hacer que su negocio crezca. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual se acerca a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para solicitar un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a esta organización, mediante el cual comprará víveres, bebidas y cárnicos, para obtener descuentos y aumentar sus ingresos. En su negocio Benjamín realiza las ventas de contado y se desempeña en su labor comercial, de lunes a domingos, con pocos descansos; las compras las realiza a crédito y de contado a distribuidores de sus productos, que le hacen buenas ofertas y le ofrecen oportunidades de acceso a artículos, con descuentos y a créditos. Su meta mas adelante es hacer reparaciones locativas a su negocio, porque él esta esmerado en hacerle a sus clientes un ambiente confortable, cuando le van a comprar  y finalmente tener una casa propia,  lo cual es muy seguramente uno de sus grandes desafíos.
texts.en:
Benjamin, 52, owns a store where he sells snack food, supplies, soft drinks, and general household items in small amounts that his customers can afford. He and his family, made up of his partner and their 4 children, ages 13 to 25, live in the southwest of the city in a neighborhood that is slowly but surely emerging from the informal economy of its residents, who are mostly independent workers with big dreams of getting ahead through their families' education. 

Currently, he needs to stock up his store because what he offers is in more and more demand every day and his inventory can't keep up with that pace due to a lack of the working capital he needs to make his business grow. That's exactly the reason that he's gotten involved with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo [Kiva field partner] to request a Kiva loan, his first from this organization, with which he will buy home supplies, beverages, and meats in bulk so as to receive discounts and increase his earnings. 

At work, Benjamin is busy manning the cash register and attending to his business from Monday to Sunday with few breaks. He makes his purchases on credit and in cash from suppliers that can offer him deals and opportunities to buy items at a discount. His most pressing goals are to make certain repairs to his business, as he's focussed on providing a comfortable environment for his customers when they come in to shop and, ultimately, to have his own home, which is definitely one of his main struggles.

loans.use: to buy home supplies, beverages, and meats for sale.

loans.name: Kimberly Stefania

texts.es:
Kimberly comenzó hace 2 años trabajando en un cyber, pero con un préstamo familiar decidió establecer su propio negocio. En la actualidad posee un cyber con muy buena clientela, ya que está ubicado cerca de la Plaza cívica del Cantón Playas. Trabaja en su cyber desde las 8:00 de la mañana, sale al almuerzo una hora y regresar a trabajar hasta la 7:00pm. 

Unas de sus dificultades es un poco la delincuencia de la zona en la que se encuentra ubicado el cyber, pero ya puso puerto eléctrico con rejas para evitar que le roben. 

Kimberly está  separada tiene 1 hijo pequeño que aun no estudia. Con  el préstamo va a comprar recargas celulares, papelería y una impresora. Unas de sus aspiraciones es tener una casa cómoda para su hijo pequeño, seguir creciendo en su negocio. hasta tener una sucursal en  Posorja.
texts.en: Kimberly began working two years ago at a cyber cafe, and with a loan from a family member she started her one business. Now she runs her own cyber cafe which has a strong clientele because her business is located next to the Civic Square in the Playas neighborhood. She works from 8:00 in the morning, has a one our lunch break, and then returns to work until 7:00 pm. One of her difficulties is there is some crime in her neighborhood. However, she has installed an electric door with bars to protect her business from potential robbers. Kimberly is separated and has a young son who is not yet school age. With the loan she will buy credit to recharge cell phones as well as purchase a printer and stationary. Her goal is to have a comfortable house for her son and to continue growing her business until she can have a branch in the town of Posorja.

loans.use: buy a printer and stationary and purchase credit to recharge cell phones

loans.name: Concessa

texts.en:
Concessa is a widow, aged 67. She has been a maize farmer for 40 years. She plans to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The photo taken was at the previous maize ground, which the borrower will continue to use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is impacted by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Aurora E Jesus

texts.es: "Gracias por prestarme y apoyarme", son fraces que Aurora envia a sus financiadores de Kiva, pues con su anterior financiamiento logró, comprar calzado y muchos productos de belleza que vendió y ganó dinero. Hoy está aspirando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará productos de aseo, calzado de marcas costosas, pues se prepara para el fin de año, época en la cual desde ya, sus clientes han solicitado mercancias que solo en esta oortunidad pueden comprar, porque es una temporada en las que reciben sus primas y bonificaciones y esto es justamente lo que hace que su inversión logre el éxito esperado.
texts.en: "Thank you for lending to me and helping me" is the message that Aurora sends to her Kiva lenders, as she has previously succeeded in buying shoes and many beauty products that she was able to sell and earn income from with her last loan. Now, she's hoping for a new Kiva loan with which she will buy personal hygiene products and brand-name shoes, as she prepares for the end of the year. This is the season when in the past her customers have been looking for merchandise that they can only buy at the time because it's when they get their bonuses and advances. That's also exactly what makes her investment pay off as expected.

loans.use: to buy personal hygiene products and brand-name shoes for sale.

loans.name: Forjadores De La Vida Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “ Forjadores de la Vida” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; feriantes, venta de verduras, venta de frutas, venta de plantas, costuras, venta de manteles, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Concepción.
Mónica integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el cuarto lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un chaleco y pantalón de color lila, su cabello lo usa suelto y es de color castaño., en sus piernas lleva su cartera de color negro.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ensaladas surtidas, desde hace 12 años. Comenta que trabaja los miércoles y sábado, en las calles y otras veces en las ferias, su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en la vega (abundante comercio de productos del campo) donde encuentra sus verduras frescas a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará aceitunas, repollo, lechugas, zanahorias para abastecer su negocio.
Una de las metas de Monica es crecer y llegar a tener un local para ofrecer su mercadería, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Monica vive junto a su esposo y 3 hijos quienes dos de ellos se encuentran estudiando y el mayor trabajando. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener su local, y a nivel familiar tener su casa propia ya que vive de allegada en el terreno de madre.
Ella esta muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e intereses, lo cual le ha servido como un momento de distracción.
 Respecto a la s capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en: The "Forjardores de La Vida" community bank consists of 17 enterprising women who make a living in different trades, among which: selling at flea markets, selling vegetables, selling fruits, selling plants, sewing, selling table clothes, and other services. All of the members are from the city of Concepción, Chile. Mónica, a group member who is seated in the photo fourth from the right in the front row with a lilac jumpsuit, has made a living selling assorted salads for the past 12 years. She says she works Wednesdays and Saturdays, selling in the streets and other times at flea markets, her schedule depending on availability. She buys her merchandise and supplies at the commercial center where farmers bring in their products, where she finds fresh vegetables at low costs, which is financially beneficial. With the loan, she plans to purchase olives, cabbage, lettuce and carrots to stock her business. One of Mónica's goals is for her business to grow and to have a store where she can offer her products so she can generate more income and thus improve her quality of life. Mónica lives with her husband and their three children, two of whom are in school and the oldest of whom is working. Her dream for work is having her own store, and her familial dream is to have her own home since they live on her mother's land. She is very content and grateful for the opportunity provided by Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza, which has allowed her to invest in her business. Furthermore, she feels comfortable with the fellow members of her community bank, because the different activities and interests serve as a welcomed distraction. In respect to the training she has received at the group meetings, she has learned to better administer her business. Concepción is seated at the mouth of the Biobío River, one of the largest in the country, in southern Chile in the region of Biobío. It has played an important role in the nation's history, being sight of important battles and treaties, especially during the Arauco War (a long-running conflict between colonial Spaniards and the Mapuche people). Currently the city is undergoing an important economic and demographic development to come to be considered one of the most relevant urban, demographic, administrative, financial and commercial centers in Chile, after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: to purchase olives, cabbage, lettuce and carrots to stock her business.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Mi nombre es Manuel, soy un costarricense de 42 años de edad, vivo en la provincia de Heredia,  padre de dos adolescentes, trabajo independiente como electricista, he formado mi propia empresa, poco a poco he ido aumentando mi clientela, pero necesito equipo de trabajo ( herramientas para electricista) con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio a mis clientes, estoy solicitando quinientos cincuenta mil colones (₡ 550.000) , con este préstamo compraré una máquina para soldar y otras herramientas que necesito para realizar mi trabajo con calidad y eficiencia.
Con mi ingreso económico llevo el sustento a mi hogar y pago la educación de mis hijos, mi sueño es ver crecer mi empresa y beneficiar a otros con empleo . Estoy muy agradecido con Dios por esta oportunidad de crédito rápido y sin requisitos difíciles de cumplir.
texts.en:
My name is Manuel, and I'm a 42 year old Costa Rican. I live in the province of Heredia, and have two teenage children. I work as an independent electrician. I have formed my own company and little by little have grown my client base, but I need electrian's tools in order to provide my clients with better service. I am applying for a loan of 550,000 colones; with this loan I will buy a soldering machine and other tools that I need to do efficient and high quality work. 

With my income I provide for my family and pay for my children's education. My dream is to grow my business and be able to employ other people. I am very thankful to God for this loan opportunity because it is fast and its terms are not difficult to fulfill.

loans.use: purchase a soldering machine and other tools for electricians

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 28-year-old married woman with four family members from Jarash, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture. In the future, she wants to improve her living standard. 

Since Hanan is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: James Gathii

texts.en:
James used his previous loan amount to buy fuel to sell in his business. It was profitable and he paid the loan amount in good time.

This will be his fifth loan and he plans to buy more stock of diesel to sell in his business. Since demand is high, he anticipates to make more income with which he will use to pay school fees for his children.

James hopes to open a large petrol station in the area and become a successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy more fuel to sell

loans.name: Imedal

texts.en:
Imedal is 19 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has children. For the past two years, Imedal has been working hard to manage her tailoring business.  

To help expand her business, Imedal has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy materials for making clothes for resale, and will help Imedal to generate greater profits and improve the capital in her shop. Imedal hopes that in the future she will be able to develop her business by having different fashion styles of clothes for customers. 

Imedal is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy materials for making clothes for resale.

loans.name: Eilsa

texts.es: Edilsa de 22 años de edad es la propietaria de una miscelánea, que nació por su mucha inclinación hacia los negocios desde muy niña y hoy lo hace para beneficiar el bienestar de su familia,  especialmente de sus 2 hijos, en las edades de 5 y 7 años, con quienes sueña ver convertidos en adultos  muy exitosas. Su negocio nació desde hace 6 años y es un punto comercial o miscelánea, donde vende al detalle muchos artículos, como accesorios femeninos, para el hogar, perfumería, papelería entre otros. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y de contado, mientras sus compras las hace en almacenes y cacharrerías que le venden en mayores cantidades y logra obtener descuentos cuando aplica un mayor volumen. Sus principales clientes son los vecinos del sector donde está ubicada, quienes satisfacen sus necesidades de compra en el negocio de Edilsa,  sin tener que trasladarse a los centros comerciales,  incurriendo en gastos. Su meta mas adelante es ampliar su estructura locativa y tener la oportunidad de darle una casa propia a sus hijos, quienes son la razón de su trabajo esforzado y persistente. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará una vitrina, una nevera, para vender helados y mercancía, alusiva a la fecha de amor y amistad, temporada en la cual se incrementan sus ventas y gana un poco mas.
texts.en: Eilsa is 22 years old and is the proprietor of a variety store, which arose from the strong inclination toward business that she has had since she was a child and which she now runs to benefit the well-being of her family, especially her two children, ages 5 and 7, whom she dreams of seeing become very successful adults. Her business began 6 years ago, and it is a sales point or variety store where she sells many retail items, such as feminine accessories, items for the home, perfume, and paper goods, among other items. She makes her sales on credit or for cash, while she makes her purchases in warehouses and china shops which sell to her in larger quantities and where she is able to obtain discounts when she buys a larger volume. Her principal clients are the neighbors in the district where she is located, who satisfy their shopping needs in Eilsa's business without having to travel to the commercial centers, incurring expenses. Her goal for the future is to expand her retail structure and have the opportunity to provide her children, who are the reason for her dedicated and persistent work, with their own home. She is now applying for a Kiva loan, with which she will buy a display case and a refrigerator to sell ice cream and merchandise for the day of love and friendship [February 14], a season in which she increases her sales and earns a little more.

loans.use: to buy a display cabinet and a refrigerator to sell ice cream and seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es: Soy una joven estudiante, me llamo Evelyn , ayudo a mi familia con los gastos del hogar  y por medio de las ventas por catálogo logro estudiar en horarios nocturnos , necesito tener más clientes, ya que mi meta es estudiar hasta convertirme en una profesional, estoy solicitando un crédito por un millón treinta y cinco mil colones  (¢1.035.000)  para comprar una cantidad mayor de mercadería y abarcar más localidades con lo cual aumentaré mi clientela y por consiguiente mis ingresos, agradezco la oportunidad de financiamiento por parte de este programa de crédito local.
texts.en: I am a young student. My name is Evelyn. I help my family with household expenses, and through selling items via catalog I am able to go to night school. I need to have more customers, since my goal is to study until I make myself into a professional. I'm requesting the loan to purchase a larger quantity of merchandise and to cover more ground, which will increase my clientele and my income. I am thankful for this financial opportunity through this local loan program.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products to resell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es: Julieta compró mercancías variadas,  mediante guías especializadas, como perfumes, colonias, cremas. Productos capilares, y cosméticos femeninos. Su credikiva anterior la ayudó a aumentar su capital de trabajo y con ello impulsó sus ventas,  y sus utilidades se incrementaron. En la actualidad está muy satisfecha y está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento con el cual comprará perfumes, colonias y cosméticos femeninos, productos de mayor rotación en su inventario. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Agradezco sinceramente la ayuda recibida y deseo que la vida les premien tanta generosidad”
texts.en: Julieta purchases and sells various merchandise from special catalogues, including perfumes, colognes, creams, hair products, and women’s cosmetics.  Her previous Kiva loan helped her increase her working capital, which allowed her to boost her sales and increase her profits.  She is very pleased with the results, and is currently applying for a new loan that she will use to purchase perfumes, colognes, and women’s cosmetics, which are the products in her inventory with the highest turnover.  Julieta has the following message to Kiva lenders: “I am very grateful for the help you have given me and I hope that all of your generosity will be rewarded.”

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, colognes, and women’s cosmetics.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is 42 years old. She is married to a driver. She has been a maize farmer for 24 years. She will use her Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer for her maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future, she can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The photo taken was at an older maize ground, which the borrower will still use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs

loans.name: Jovans

texts.en: Jovans is married with six children; five of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (her parents). She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 600000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.  Jovans works seven days a week at the market. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to see her business grow so that she becomes a wholesaler. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity, but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Sikukuu

texts.en:
Sikukuu is 49 years old. She is described as a hardworking woman who is very cheerful and really wants to get ahead. Sikukuu sells juice and ice cream both from her home and at a nearby school. Seeing that her business is growing every day, she has decided to take out a Yehu loan, which will be invested in buying flavoring, fresh water, plastic bags, and other necessary items needed to make her juice and ice cream. This will help her obtain better production of the products she sells and better income for her family.

Sikukuu dreams of improving her business.

loans.use: to buy flavoring, fresh water, plastic bags, and other necessary items to make juice and ice cream

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Lang is requesting a new loan to buy materials to make sandal soles. Lang's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials such as synthetic rubber

loans.name: William

texts.es: William, de 19 años, es un joven alegre y trabajador; se esmera por salir adelante para poder tener un buen futuro; vive solo en su propia casa que sus padres le dieron por herencia. Los padres del joven William, le enseñaron todo sobre lo que es trabajar en la chacra, es por ello que desde hace 10 años empezó a ganar su propio dinero laborando en los campos de cultivo de sus vecinos quienes le agradecen la ayuda de William; ahora se dedica a los cuidados de sus propias plantas de café, quien con mucho esmero logró obtener. Con el tiempo desea tener varias hectáreas con plantaciones de café y de esa forma lograr tener una buena estadía. Por tal motivo acude a las financieras de MFP, para requerir un préstamo que ayude sus planes de trabajo y en un futuro logre cumplir sus sueños. Este es su crédito número 02, esta dispuesto a ser puntual con los pagos para que en otra oportunidad logre acceder a otro crédito. En su banco comunal es muy querido por sus compañeros por ser un joven muy responsable. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará abono natural para hacer el mantenimiento de sus plantas.
texts.en:
William, 19, is a happy and hardworking young man who is making something of himself so he can have a better future. He lives alone in his own house that his parents left to him as inheritance. When he was young, William's parents taught him all about what it means to work on the farm and that's how he started earning his own money 10 years ago in his neighbors' fields who have been thankful for his help. Now he's focussed on his own coffee crops, which he was able to acquire through a lot of effort.   

In time, he hopes to have several hectares planted in coffee and that way succeed in having a good homestead. That's the what led him to seek out financing from Microfinanzas Prisma [Kiva field partner] and request a loan to help in his work plan and eventually realize his dreams. This will be his second credit and he's used to being punctual with his payments so that he may have access to future loans when he needs them. In his community bank he's much loved by those that know him for being such a responsible young man. WIth the 1,000 nuevos soles, he will buy organic fertilizer to use in caring for his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Nubia

texts.es: Mi nombre es Nubia, vivo en una zona rural de Costa Rica llamada Upala, me dedico a la ganadería, específicamente a la producción de alimentos derivados de la leche, como natilla, queso, cuajada y otros, los cuales vendo a los vecinos de mi localidad y en algunos negocios cercanos. Necesito comprar dos vacas para producir más leche y por consiguiente fabricar más productos y aumentar mis ingresos, de los cuales depende mi familia, estoy solicitando cuatrocientos mil colones (¢400.000) para lograr  mi objetivo,  me siento muy feliz de contar con esta oportunidad de financiamiento local, en buena hora!
texts.en: My name is Nubia. I live in a rural area of Costa Rica called Upala. I make a living in livestock, specifically in the production of dairy products like custards, cheese, curds and other items, which I sell to my neighbors and to some nearby businesses. I need to buy two milk-cows to produce more milk and thus have more products to sell and increase my income, upon which my family depends. I am requesting the loan to achieve this objective. I feel very happy about having this local loan opportunity, and at a good time!

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Indira

texts.es:
Soy Indira de Costa Rica, vivo en la provincia de Alajuela, trabajo en una empresa que se encuentra ubicada a unos 12 kilómetros de mi casa y he considerado comprar una motocicleta ya que soy madre de una niña y necesito estar de regreso temprano en mi casa, viajando en motocicleta gano tiempo y puedo disfrutar más a mi hija
Estoy solicitando quinientos mil colones (¢500.000) para poder comprarla, Agradezco  la oportunidad que me dan de obtener crédito rápido y oportuno por medio de este proyecto, mi hija y yo lo agradecemos!
texts.en: I am Indira from Costa Rica. I live in the province of Alajuela. I work at a company located some 12 kilometers from my home, and I have considered purchasing a motorcycle since I have a daughter and I need to be home earlier. I will save time traveling on a motorcycle and can enjoy more time with my daughter. I am requesting the loan so I can make the purchase. I appreciate the opportunity to get a loan quickly and timely for this project. My daughter and I are thankful for it!

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong is requesting a new loan to buy a greater quantity of beverages and rices to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of beverages and rices

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 51 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 24 years. He will use Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production: He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo taken was at the previous maize ground, which the Innocent will continue to use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilisers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood for making furniture

loans.name: Xuyen

texts.en: Xuyen is requesting another loan to buy a range of new beverage products in order to stock her store.  This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers.  Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer the customers a greater variety of products.  Xuyen hopes that this new loan will assist her with increasing the size of her store, increasing sales, and also helping to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of beverages to provide to her customers.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is requesting a new loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of beverages to stock her cafe. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her cafe, increasing her sales, and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of beverages for her cafe.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Rodolfo de 50 años de edad es un hombre casado que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 16 a 28 años y vive al sur de la ciudad donde tiene su propio negocio y ofrece servicios de reparación y mantenimiento de motocicletas, además de comercializa repuestos para vehículos; él desde muy joven se dedicó a la mecánica de motocicletas, porque le ha gustado siempre este oficio, el cual convirtió posteriormente en su principal actividad  generadora de ingresos. Su experiencia de 27 años,  hace que Rodolfo sea muy reconocido entre su clientela, ubicada alrededor se su barrio y en general son conductores de motocicletas o propietarios que se aceran a su negocio a comprarle, porque allí encuentran un servicio completo y de calidad.   En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará repuestos, bujías, neumáticos y partes eléctricas;  con esta inversión  proyecta incrementar sus ventas y así mismo generar mas utilidades con este nuevo capital de trabajo, el que mueve diariamente con sus ventas, impulsadas desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Su meta mas adelante es lograr tener un almacén en un sitio mucho mas estratégico y en un ambiente confortable, para lograr impactar a su clientela y sentirse mas cómodo en su tarea diaria.
texts.en: Rodolfo, 50, is a married man that has three children ages ranging from 16-28 and lives in the South part of the city where he has his own business and offers the services of repair and maintenance of motorbikes, he also sells spare parts for cars; since he was young he started working in the mechanics of motorbikes because he's always liked this trade that later became his principal activity to generate income.  He has 27 years of experience that is recognized by his customers, who live in the surrounding neighborhood and are drivers or owners that come to his business because they know they can get full quality service.  He is now requesting a loan to Kiva, first credit through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy spare parts, spark plugs, tires and electric cords; with this investment he projects an increase in sales and thus more profits as a result of this new working capital, used daily through sales resulting from work that starts at 7 AM and ends at 7PM.  His future goal is to have his shop in a more strategic location and in a more comfortable environment, to be able to make an impact to his customer and feel comfortable doing his daily activities.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, spark plugs, tires and electric cords.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 26 years old. He is married to Anita and together they have one child who is one year. Richard runs an M-PESA point, which is a local money transfer service, and he has been in this business for the past two years with good income.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD .He hopes to add more business float (electronic credits to sell in his mobile money business) so that he is able to serve his customers well. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to start building rental houses in the near future.

loans.use: to add more business float (electronic credits to sell in his mobile money business)

loans.name: Thao

texts.en: Thao is requesting a new loan to buy a variety of goods, food and beverages to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase the size of her store, increase sales, and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods, food and beverages to restock her store.

loans.name: Tu

texts.en:
Tu is 56 years old and divorced with one son. Tu has been running a general store in front of her door for 13 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her child. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Tu is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying many kinds of foods, such as snacks and instant noodles, and household items to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of foods, such as snacks and instant noodles, and household items to stock her store

loans.name: Xuan

texts.en:
Xuan, 63, is single and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income running a cafe in front of her house. 

She started this business twenty-five years ago. She sells coffee, soft drinks, and other beverages to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular beverages, to stock her cafe and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, in particular beverages, to stock her cafe

loans.name: Ezechiel

texts.en:
Ezechiel is 50 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 26 years. He will use Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production: He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo taken was at the previous maize ground, where the Ezechiel will continue to farm for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilisers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Khoa

texts.en:
Khoa is 35 years old and is married. His wife supports their family by working as a nanny. They have 2 children who live with them in Ho Chi Minh City.

Khoa has runs a motorbike and car wash service for 4 years. He intends to use his loan to buy oil and equipment to better serve his customers.

He hope his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his family's living conditions, allowing him to save money for his children's education.

loans.use: To buy oil and equipment to better serve his customers

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa, 26, is married and has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop in the local community for eight years. She lives with her daughter and  husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living working as a waiter in a restaurant. 

Hoa plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail-polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail-polish

loans.name: Jairo Esteban

texts.es: Jairo tiene 30 años, está casado y tiene dos hijos, vive en el municipio de la Masica, departamento de  Atlántida. Jairo tiene su propio negocio establecido en su casa, desde hace 3 años el cuenta con un taller de ebanistería y tallado de madera, donde realiza trabajos en madera como puertas, muebles de cocina, closet, roperos y tallados en puertas. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo el cual es por 21,000 Lempiras, con este préstamo va comprar una maquina cateadora la cual sirve para realizar trabajos de tallado en madera, y le ayudara a realizar los trabajos con más rapidez. Su meta es trabajar duro para superarse en todos los aspectos de su vida.
texts.en: Jairo, 30, is married and has 2 children.  He lives in the municipality of Masica, in the department of Atlantida.  For 3 years, Jairo has had his own business set up in his house.  He has a cabinetmaking and woodworking workshop where he makes all kinds of products from wood, including doors, kitchen cabinets, closets, armoires and carved wooden doors.  He is requesting his second loan, for 21,000 Honduran lempiras, to buy a jig saw that will serve him in his woodworking projects and allow him to work more rapidly.  His goal is to work hard so that he can excel in all aspects of his life.

loans.use: to buy a jig saw for his woodworking shop

loans.name: Katheryn

texts.es: Katheryn es una joven con 24 años de edad, soltera y madre de una niña de dos años. Vive con sus padres. Es una mujer con muchos deseos de superación, trabajadora y con visión empresarial. Ella está cursando el quinto año de la secundaria por madurez. Se dedica a las ventas por catálogo de productos amway desde hace varios meses y le ha ido muy bien. Ahora quiere invertir también en ropa como pijamas, debido a que piensa que tiene buen mercado para su venta. Ésto con el fin de poder salir adelante, ayudarse en sus estudios universitarios y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en: Katheryn is a young woman of 24 and a single mother of a 2-year-old daughter, and lives with her parents. She's a hard-working entrepreneurial-minded woman with many hopes for improving her life. She's completing coursework in her fifth year of high school equivalency. She has been making catalog-order sales of Amway products for several months and it's gone very well. Now she's also looking to invest in clothes such as pijamas, as she believes she has a good market for selling them. Her aim is to be able to get ahead, help put herself through her university studies, and improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy Amway hygiene products and clothing for sale.

loans.name: Heliana Soraya

texts.es: Heliana de 35 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos , en el municipio de Soledad, a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla;  allí se dedica a  la preparación y venta de alimentos, desde hace 9 años; sus principales productos son los arepas, deditos de queso, y empanadas y su clientela la constituyen vendedores ambulantes y almacenes del sector. Diariamente desde las 7 de la mañana se dedica a la preparación y veta de sus productos, mediante un proceso de cocción, molienda, adobe, recorte y empaque. Sus ventas las realiza en un 60% de contado mientras en un 40%, lo hace a crédito. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará maíz, harina, queso, bandejas y empaques desechables. Con su anterior financiamiento logró incrementar su capital de trabajo y aumentar el volumen de sus ventas.  Por eso está muy satisfecha e invertirá nuevamente para aumentar su potencial de ganancias.
texts.en: Heliana is 35 years old and lives with her spouse and their two children in the town of Soledad, 10 minutes from the city of Barranquilla, where she has made a living preparing and selling food for the past nine years. Her main products are traditional regional dishes like arepas (a kind of corn bread), cheese sticks and empanadas, and her customers are street merchants and grocery stores in the area. She dedicates herself to preparing and selling her products every day from 7 a.m., through a process of cooking, grinding, molding, trimming and packaging. Sixty percent of her sales are on cash, the other 40 percent on credit. She is requesting another Kiva loan, her second one through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase corn, flour, cheese, trays and disposable packaging. With her previous loan, she was able to increase her working capital and expand her sales volume, so she is very satisfied and will invest once again to grow her potential earnings.

loans.use: to purchase corn, flour, cheese, trays and disposable packaging

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong, 49, is divorced and has one son and one daughter. She lives with them in Ho Chi Minh City. Phuong supports her family by running a general store. She started this business 30 years ago. She sells cosmetics, toothpaste, and many kinds of food to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of items, such as cosmetics, milk, cheese, pies, and soft drinks to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and generates a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of items, such as cosmetics, milk, cheese, pies, and soft drinks to stock her store

loans.name: Jenni Lizett

texts.es: Jenni, tiene 31 años d edad, vive en el municipio de San Manuel, Cortes junto a su conyugue y su hijo. Ella ha establecido su propio negocio desde hace dos años, para vender productos de la canasta básica familiar ofreciendo carnes, lácteos, embutidos, refrescos, arroz, frijoles, productos de limpieza, etc. anteriormente trabajaba en una maquila pero sus ingresos eran pocos, por eso decidió establecer este negocio donde ya tiene buena clientela y obtiene más ingresos. Ella está solicitando un préstamo por 11,000 Lempiras para mantener siempre surtido el negocio y satisfacer al cliente, se abastecerá de granos básicos, carnes y refrescos. Tiene como meta seguir con su negocio para no ser una asalariada y que su hijo termine sus estudios.
texts.en: Jenni is 31 years old, and she lives in the town of San Manuel in the department of Cortes with her husband and son.  She established her own business 2 years ago, where she sells consumer staples such as: meat, dairy products, sausages, drinks, rice, beans, cleaning products, etc.  She previously worked in a maquila (manufacturing plant), but since her earnings were low she decided to establish her own business, which already has a good customer base and earns her more income.  She is requesting a loan for 11,000 Honduran lempiras to keep her store stocked so that she can keep her customers satisfied.  She will stock up on staple grains, meats and drinks.  Jenni's goal is to continue with her business so that she doesn't have to go back to working for a salary.  She also wants to see her son finish his education.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, meats and drinks to stock her store

loans.name: Hue

texts.en: Hue is a 59-year-old divorced woman with three daughters. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Hue has run a food stall in front of her house for the past six years. She sells steamed rice pancakes and pork pies. She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing more rice and food ingredients at wholesale prices to produce more food to sell. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more rice and food ingredients

loans.name: Qua

texts.en: Qua, a 62-year-old married man, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. He has one son and five daughters. He and his wife run a business selling cloth to people in the local community. Qua requests a loan to purchase more cloth to stock his shop. This will enable him to offer a better range of products to his customers. He hopes his business will run smoothly and that he will earn additional income to reinvest in his shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth to stock his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, soap, irrigation hoses, and chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi has been running a shop where she sells rice and other items. She started this business with help from her husband and learned this way of selling from her friends. The problem she faces is a lack of products since she has a big shop. She is requesting a loan to increase the amount of products since she has more customers and a big shop. She enjoys this business because it keeps her busy. Naomi is a university graduate, 47 years old, and married with five children between 17 and 28 years old. Three of her children are in high school and the two oldest are attending college. All of them live at home in the area of Gbarnga. Her dream is to expand her business even more and see all her children graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
Marvín, tiene la necesidad de invertir en el negocio, comprándose 10 juegos de sillas y mesas, además invertirá en la compra de materiales de cocina, como aceite, condimentos, materiales plásticos,  que son los necesarios para poder continuar produciendo.
Él considera que a través de los créditos él y sus negocios han logrado sobrevivir, teniendo lo necesario para trabajar, en su familia las condiciones económicas están mejorando todo a través del buen funcionamiento del negocio.
texts.en:
Marvin needs to invest in his business by purchasing 10 sets of tables and chairs. In addition, he will buy cooking supplies such as oil, condiments, and plastic utensils that are needed to continue with production.

Marvin says that the loans have helped him and his businesses to survive since they have provided him with what he needs for his work. His family’s financial condition has improved and everything is functioning well with his businesses.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies and 10 sets of tables and chairs.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is a 47-year-old single woman. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Nga has run a food stall in front of her house for the past six years. She  sells steamed rice pancakes and pork pies. 

She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing new furniture and dishes. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new furniture and dishes for her food stall.

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili, 28, is married and lives with her spouse and their two children, one of whom attends school. For the last two years, she’s been working selling snacks like dumplings and flat breads.

Mwanapili is asking for a 15,000 KES loan to buy ingredients like sugar, wheat flour, cooking oil, and baking powder. She trusts that her profits will increase so that she can support her family and continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, wheat flour, cooking oil, and baking powder for her food stall.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene una tienda en la que vende mochilas. Estando en Finca logró el acabado de su casa, así como poder pagar la educación de sus hijos. Las capacitaciones son de su agrado, porque le parecen muy interesantes. Ella, se encuentra agradecida por las facilidades de préstamo. Con el nuevo préstamo que solicita  comprará más mercadería y pagar al alquiler del local. Su sueño es tener un local propio para el negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria has a store where she sells backpacks. Being a member of FINCA has enabled her to finish her house and pay for her children’s education. Victoria enjoys the training classes because they seem very interesting to her. She is grateful for the loan services.

With this new loan she is requesting, Victoria will buy more merchandise and pay the rent on her shop. Her dream is to have her own storefront for her business.

loans.use: to buy backpacks and pay the rent on her shop.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, 38, is married and has one son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband supports their family by running a cafe. Hong earns a living running a general store in front of her house. She started this business ten years ago. She sells many items to people in her community. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products such as socks, tobacco and chewing gum to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and to set aside some money for facing difficulty in the future.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products such as socks, tobacco and chewing gum to stock her general store.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos tiene 21 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida junto a su esposa e hijo y su madre. Carlos tiene su propia fuente de ingresos, hace 9 meses estableció un negocio en su casa de venta de toda clase de carnes: carne de res, cerdo y pollo. Ademas vende verduras y condimentos. El esta solicitando un préstamo por 12,000 Lempiras para comprar productos para surtir el negocio, como ser: carnes, verduras y especies o condimentos. Con esta inversión el espera incrementar las ventas y le ayudara a capitalizarse y seguir invirtiendo. Tiene como su meta crecer en el negocio, aumentar las ganancias y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 21 years old, married, and has one child. He lives in the town of Tela, Atlántida, with his wife, son, and mother. Carlos has his own source of income.

Nine months ago, he established his own business from home where he sells all types of meat: beef, pork, and chicken. He also sells vegetables and condiments. Carlos is requesting a loan of 12,000 HNL in order to buy products to restock his business such as meats, vegetables, spices, and condiments. With this investment, he hopes to increase his sales and build up capital for future investment. His dreams are to grow his business, increase his earnings, and provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy meats, vegetables, spices, and condiments.

loans.name: Tiep

texts.en:
Tiep is a 60-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. She and her husband earn a living running a general store, which they have done for 25 years. 

Tiep would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods, confectionery and cosmetics, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that, through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods, confectionery and cosmetics.

loans.name: Jose Israel

texts.es:
Jose, se dedica a la panadería desde hace 10 años, vive con su esposa no tiene hijos hasta el momento, su trabajo en la panadería la aprendió desde niño y trabaja junto a un señor con quien comparte en las ventas, hoy él quiere independizarse y poder iniciar su propio negocio para esto deberá incurrir en algunos gastos que piensa cubrirlos a través de un préstamo.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de un horno panificador de gas, con esta herramienta que es la principal comenzará a producir su propio pan permitiéndole crear una nueva clientela y poder trabajar para su familia de forma independiente.

Su objetivo es con el préstamo es que le permita ayudar a instalar la panadería, a futuro quiere crecer, expandirse en la zona como siempre trabajando independiente sólo para su familia.
texts.en:
Jose has been a baker for the past 10 years. He lives with his wife, but they do not have any children at the moment. He learned this trade by working at a bakery since he was a boy, but then he began making sales by working with an older gentleman with whom he shares the profits.

Jose now wants to become independent and start his own business. In order to do this, he needs a loan to cover some of his upfront expenses that he will incur. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a gas-powered oven since this will be the main piece of equipment that he needs for making his own bread. This will help him to establish a new customer base and work independently so that he can support his family.

Jose’s goal with this loan is to establish his bakery so that it can grow in the future. He wants to keep maturing so that he can always work independently on behalf of his family.

loans.use: to buy a gas-powered oven.

loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en:
Cleophas is 46 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 26 years. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

This photo taken was at the previous maize ground, which the borrower will still use for the new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos, vive en el municipio de Santa cruz de Yojoa junto a su hija menor. Doña Lucia tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería como ropa, perfumes, cosméticos, sandalias y ropa interior. Este negocio lo mantiene en su casa y sale a vender a las comunidades más cercanas y las ventas son de contado y por pedidos la mayor parte de su  mercadería. Esta solicitando un préstamo de 10,000 Lempiras para surtir de mercadería como ropa, sandalias, cosméticos y otros. Ella espera que su negocio se mantenga surtido para incrementar las ventas y las ganancias, ya que es su fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento familiar.
texts.en:
Lucia is 53 years old and a single mother of five children. She lives in the town of Santa Cruz de Yojoa with her youngest daughter.

For the past 10 years, Doña Lucia has been selling merchandise such as clothing, perfumes, cosmetics, sandals, and undergarments. This business has enabled her to maintain her home. She sells her products in the nearby communities and conducts her sales on a cash basis. Most of the merchandise she offers is sold through orders.

Lucia is requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL so that she can restock with merchandise such as clothing, sandals, cosmetics, and other items. She hopes to keep her business stocked so that she can increase her sales and her earnings. This is the only source of income that she has to support her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing, sandals, cosmetics, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es: El señor Eugenio tiene 52 años casado con 4 hijos dos ya independientes y dos se encuentran estudiando, es cliente antiguo, el crédito será destinado para la compra de de ropa como abrigos largos, el Sr. Eugenio es una persona muy trabajadora se siente muy feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan, ya que con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y creció en su actividad.
texts.en:
Sr. Eugenio is 52 years old, married, and has four children. Two of his children are already independent and the other two are in school. He is a long-time client and will use this loan to purchase clothing, such as large coats.

Sr. Eugenio is a hardworking individual who is very pleased and appreciative of the opportunity that has been given to him. He did very well with his previous loan and was able to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy large coats.

loans.name: Tara's Group

texts.en:
Tara is a 29-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother to one child. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Tara is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Tara has 7 years experience with the small home-based business activity. To improve the services she can offer to her customers and to create a more pleasant work environment she would like to buy a new sewing machine and also an A/C unit for her work area. To make these purchases she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and an A/C unit for her work area

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 57 years old and married with 2 sons. She and her husband support their family by running a beverage store in the local community, which they have done for five years.

Hoa would like to borrow a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of beverages to sell from her store. She hope that this will increase the turnover of her business and increase her income. 

She hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of beverages to sell from her store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a widow aged 64. She has been a maize farmer for 40 years. She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The photo taken was at another maize ground, which the borrower will still use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Haubir

texts.en:
Haubir is a 28-year-old, ambitious Iraqi man with a shop that manufactures and supplies high quality PVC casement windows and doors. The business has been steadily growing in the past 12 years, and with numerous construction sites around the city, it is expected to keep growing and successfully generating revenue. 

Haubir would like to improve the business and renew the work area, which is currently dark and dusty, located in a large basement. He would also like to buy some good quality raw materials.

To make these purchases, he took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 3000 USD. 

Haubir is under 30, and qualifies for a "youth loan"

loans.use: to renew the work area and buy some good quality raw materials

loans.name: Doan

texts.en:
Doan is a 42-year-old widowed woman. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She sells vermicelli and sour crab soup in the local community. 

Doan would like to get a loan to buy a larger quantity and better quality of food such as meat and other ingredients to sell from her stall. 

She hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity and better quality of food such as meat and other ingredients to sell from her stall

loans.name: Alexandra Narcisa

texts.es:
La Sra. Alexandra  tiene aproximadamente 10 años en el negocio. Comenzó vendiendo productos yanbal y poco a poco creció hasta que pudo establecer su propio bazar y novedades  ubicado en el lugar donde reside. 
Realiza su trabajo sola, otras de su actividades para tener mas ingresos en la tarde vende almuerzos a profesores de una escuela cercana a su casa. 
Una de sus dificultades es la delincuencia que ronda en el sector. Alexandra es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos 16, 12,8 estudian en escuela y colegio particular. Con  el préstamo va a comprar una impresora, confitería y vitrina. Unas de  sus metas poder crecer en el negocio, contar con el capital necesario para invertir en grandes cantidades. Y le pide a Dios que le de salud necesaria para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Alexandra has been in business for approximately 10 years. She began selling Yanbal products and grew her business until she was able to establish her own bazaar and novelty shop in the place where she resides.

Alexandra works alone. She engages in other business activities to generate more income. In the afternoons, she sells lunches to the teachers at a school near her home.

One of her difficulties is dealing with the crime that occurs around her area. Alexandra is a single mother with three children (ages 16, 12, and 8) who attend private schools. She will use this loan to buy a printer, candies, and a display cabinet. Among her goals are to grow her business and to have the necessary capital to invest in large quantities of merchandise. She asks that God keeps her healthy so that she can help her children get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a printer, candies, and a display cabinet.

loans.name: Jeredi

texts.en:
Jeredi is 68 years old, and he is married to a farmer. Jeredi has been a maize farmer for 40 years. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production - he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo taken was at the previous seasons maize ground, which the borrower will still use for this new season. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianey

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianey is 36 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 20 years. He will use Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production: He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo taken recently at  previous maize farming plantation, was very happy and excited that previous season was very helpful for both family needs and business. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilisers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Exalashasman

texts.es: Exalashasman de  36 anos de edad, casado con 3 hijos menores de edad de 14,6,2 anos el Sr.Exalashasman pertenece al departamento de Chinandega, un lugar que se caracteriza por se una zona muy comercial, con gente muy trabajadora, responsable. El sr. Tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, donde vende granos básicos, verduras, gaseosas, jugos, salsas,  a vecinos de contado y también presta servicio de chofer de camión en un ingenio  azucarero ,la pulperia la  tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación, tiene  4 anos de tener el negocio. En la actualidad Exalashasman ha presentado desafíos y problemas que enfrenta la familia como es el problema de salud de una de sus hijas la cual esta perdiendo la visión en uno de sus ojitos. El objetivo del préstamo en invertir en mercadería para poder surtir mas el negocio, ya que por los gastos médicos de su hija de descapitalizo el negocio. El Sr.  Exalashasman  agradece de corazón a los inversionistas kiva la ayuda que les brindan a personas de escasos recursos para poder tener un medio de vida digno  y brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Exalashasman is 36 years old, married, and has three children (ages 14, 6, and 2). He lives in the Department of Chinandega, a place that is known for being a commercial area and having people who are hardworking and responsible.

Sr. Exalashasman has a convenience store in his home where he sells basic grains, vegetables, sodas, juices, and sauces to his neighbors on a cash basis. He also works as a truck driver for a sugar mill. His convenience store is located in his home and he has been in business for four years. He and his family are currently facing some challenges. For example, one of his daughters is losing vision in one of her eyes.

Exalashasman will invest his loan in merchandise so that he can restock his store. His daughter’s medical expenses have drained capital out of his business. He is grateful for the hearts of Kiva lenders who provide assistance to people with limited resources so that they can earn a decent living and provide better living conditions for their families.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, bread, milk, eggs, and other products.

loans.name: Alciria

texts.es:
Mi nombre es Alciria, costarricense, madre de un adolescente de 14 años, vivo en una zona rural ubicada a 45 kilómetros de la capital, me dedico a crear ganado para engorde el cual vendo en las ferias ganaderas y ganado para la producción de leche,con la cual elaboro productos como  natilla,  mantequilla, queso y otros.
Trabajo fuertemente para darle a mi hijo lo que necesita a diario y para los estudios, ya que deseo que sea un profesiona en el futuro. Estoy solicitando un crédito por un millón treinta y cinco mil colones (¢1.035.000)
para comprar dos vacas y aumentar la producción de leche, elaborar mayor cantidad de productos lácteos y a la vez aumentar mis ganancias.
Agradezco a este proyecto y a la empresa de crédito comunal de mi zona la oportunidad que me da para realizar mis sueños, y los de mi hijo.
texts.en:
Here is Alciria’s story:

“My name is Alciria. I am from Costa Rica and the mother of a teenager who is 14. I live in a rural area that is 45 kilometers outside of the capital. I raise cattle for fattening and then sell them at the livestock fairs. I also own dairy cows and use the milk to make sour cream, butter, cheese, and other products.

I work hard so that I can provide for my son’s daily needs and his education. I want him to become a professional in the future. I am requesting a loan of 1,035,000 CRC so that I can buy two dairy cows in order to increase milk production and generate more earnings.

I am grateful for having my business and to my local Communal Bank for giving me the opportunity to fulfill my dreams and those of my son.”

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Brigida Narcisa

texts.es:
Brigida de 36 años comenzo con un local de helados que lo alquilaba. Quizo implementar su idea de una tienda. Es ahora que en la actualidad que su trabajo lo hace mediante planificaciones y con la ayuda de su mama que vive con ella su horario de trabajo comienza desde las 8:00am hasta las 22:45pm. 
Una de sus dificultades es que tiene un malestar en la columna que no le permite hacer con normalidad su trabajo. Brigida es madre soltera y tiene 3 hjos los gemelos de 7 años y una niña de 6 años y estudian es escuela particular.  

Con el prestamo va a comprar mercaderia para la tienda como confites, dulces, enlatados, bebidas etc. Una de sus metas que es sus hijos puedan tener una educacion adecuada y poder realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda y ampliacion de su local.
texts.en:
Brigida is 36 years old. She started out managing an ice cream shop from a rented location, but then she came up with the idea to open a store. With a bit of planning, she now works in this business that she operates with the help of her mother who lives with her. Brigida’s work schedule is from 8:00 A.M. to 10:45 P.M.

One of her challenges is dealing with discomfort in her spinal column, which prevents her from working normally. Brigida is a single mother with three children, seven-year-old twin boys and a six-year-old daughter who attend a private school.

With this loan, Brigida will buy merchandise for her store such as snack foods, candy, canned goods, beverages, and other products. Among her goals are to provide an adequate education for her children, make improvements to her home, and expand her store.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, candy, canned goods, beverages, and other products.

loans.name: Maria
