In the future, Thảo hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a net to fish.

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en:
Mr. Altantuya, who is 43 years old, lives with his wife and two children, in a house, in the Orhon province of Mongolia. His wife's name is Dariimaa. His son is a college student, and his daughter is secondary school student. Since 1994, Mr. Altantuya has been doing his organic vegetable business in Uvs and Orhon provinces. He plants organic potatoes, organic tomatos, cucumbers etc. He is well-experienced in this sector. 

His wife, Dariimaa, rents an organic vegetable-selling counter in the market of Orhon province. Mr. Altantuya planted a 5.5 hectare organic vegetable field.  He is asking for 5,000,000 MNT to spend on gasoline, food and wages for his workers to harvest organic vegetables. He is honest, and his family members are hardworking people.

loans.use: To pay for gasoline, food and wages for his workers to harvest organic vegetables.

loans.name: Men's Group

texts.en:
Age 62 years, Men is a widowed mother of six children, one of whom is dependent on her and helps the family’s business. Men lives in a rural village of the Or Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has struggled to feed the children through farming rice on one hectare of farmland. Having been in this business for 27 years, she is able to earn about 10,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 3,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. 

Men is in her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group of two females to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy a water pump for her rice field. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice more productively and qualitatively so as to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and a water pump for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan José  es un hombre agricultor de 33 años de edad. El vive en Sololá, con su esposa, su hija de 2 años y sus padres. 

El cultiva zuquini, alverja china y maíz en el lugar de su vivienda. Lo realiza desde hace 7 años por que se dio cuenta que son las verduras que mantienen mejores precios en su región. La cual tiene el deseo de seguir sembrando en otros terrenos que el tiene para tener beneficios. 

El necesita y solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de Q 4,000.00 para la compra de plantillas de alverja china, abono orgánico, insecticida y mas. Viendo las ganancias que obtiene actualmente el quiere seguir trabajando más para sostener a toda su familia.

En el futuro el sueña con construir una mejor vivienda y poder darle mejores estudios académicos a su hija ya que el no tuvo esa oportunidad de asistir a una escuela pero quiere darle ese apoya a su hija.
texts.en:
Juan José is a 33 year old farmer.  He lives in Sololá with his wife, their two year old daughter, and his parents.

He grows zucchini, snow peas, and corn at the place where his house is.  He has been doing this for seven years because he realized that these are the vegetable that maintain better prices in his region.  He wishes to continue planting on other land that he has in order to have profits.

He needs to request a loan for 4,000 quetzales in order to buy young snow pea plants, organic fertilizer, insecticide, and more.  Upon seeing the income that he currently gets, he wants to continue working more in order to support his whole family.

In the future he dreams of building a better house and being able to give his daughter a better education.  He never had the opportunity to go to school, and he wants to give this support to his daughter.

loans.use: to buy young snow pea plants to cultivate.

loans.name: Ut

texts.en:
Ut is a 50-year-old widowed woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. 

Ut earns a living running a general store and Internet service, which she has done for 20 years. 

Ut would like to take a loan to renovate her Internet service by buying new computers and accessories. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy new computers and accessories for her internet service.

loans.name: Kristiani

texts.en:
Kristiani is a 42 years old entrepreneur. She is married and has four children who are between 16 and 6 years old. All the children are attending school. 

Kristiani runs several businesses that enable her to generate income for her family. The businesses are a rented house, a kiosk and distribution of tamarind kickshaw. 

At the moment, Kristiani has four new rooms built to be lease out, but she has limited capital to provide window sills and door frames. For this reason, Kristiani is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,500,000. The loan would enable Kristiani to purchase four window sills and four door frames for the new rooms.

loans.use: to purchase four window sills and four door frames for the new rooms.

loans.name: Giau

texts.en:
Giau is 54 years old and divorced. She has two daughters. 

She supports her family by selling seafood in the local community. She would like to borrow a loan to buy a larger quantity and higher quality of food such as shellfish, snails and other ingredients at wholesale prices to sell from her stall. 

She hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity and higher quality of food such as shellfish and snails to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Heam's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural area of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, Heam is 57 years old and married with five children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, Heam has been farming rice on five-hectare of farmland for 25 years and complements the family’s income by raising pigs. She is able to earn about 15,000 KHR per day and save about 7,000 KHR each day for future needs. Low price of her crop yield is the main challenge for her paddy-field. 

Heam’s group consists of four female members; all of whom are first-time borrowers and requesting the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Heam is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy pig feed. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and fruitfully so as to make living better and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and pig's feed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: 040134 Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhiều operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase a net to fish. 

Nhiều is 54 years old and she is married with four children. She supports two of her children who are dependent on her with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Nhiều has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Nhiều faces in her business is the lack of capital.

This is Nhiều  first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 040138 Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường  solidarity group. 

In the future, Nhiều hopes her children will graduate from college and find a good job, and that she will maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a net to fish.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Oun, 45 years old, is a married mother who lives in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has five children, two of whom are dependent on her. To make a living, she has been working in rubber-fields for others for a fee. Engaging in this business for twenty-five years, she is able to earn about 8,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 2,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Oun’s group consists of three members. She has already been with VisionFund for one cycle while the other members are new to VisionFund this cycle. The first loan, which she has recently just repaid, helped her to relieve family’s burden and improve their livelihood. 

Now she and her group members are seeking for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to renovate her house. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent house for her children, so she does not need to worry about her house conditions especially during the rainy season.

loans.use: To renovate her house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Thavy's Group

texts.en:
Thavy, 39, lives in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is married with four children, two of whom are dependent on her. To support the family, she has been working in a rubber-field for others for a fee. Having been involved in this for five years, she is able to earn about 8,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 2,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses for future needs. 

This is Thavy’s second loan with VisionFund and she completely repaid the past loan which has improved her family living’s conditions. Now she is leading her group of three to apply for a loan. Thavy, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy household supplies. She hopes this loan will enable her to have enough working capital for running a new business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy household supplies.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: 58-07-03-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hạnh works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise for reselling in the future. 

Hạnh is 55 years old, married, and has two children. She is the group leader of the 58-07-03-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of seven members. 

She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent, her other child is grown. 

In 2010, Hạnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hạnh has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hạnh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Hạnh faces in her business is the lack of capital. 

With her business profits, Hạnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to graduate from college, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise for reselling in the future.

loans.name: Sonia Patricia

texts.es:
Sonia inicio con su negocio gracias a la ayuda de sus familiares que la vieron sola y le recomendaron poner su negocio en casa. Ahora pueda  cuidar a sus a 2 hijos unos ya es mayor de edad y el otro es menor que están bajo su responsabilidad gracias al apoyo de sus familiares ha podido seguir adelante. Su trabajo lo hace sola desde las 8:00am hasta las 18:00pm.

Tiene un taller de costura en donde hace blusas, vestidos. Unas de sus dificultades son las enfermedades ya cuando se enferma tiene que sacar Fuerzas de donde sea ya que es el pilar fundamental en su hogar. Con el prestamo quiere comprar telas y una maquina de coser. Unas de sus metas es trabajar para mi familia y seguir trabajando para  D-miro para aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia started her business based on the support of her relatives who saw that she was alone and suggested establishing a business at home. 

Now is able to take care of her two children. One of them is already grown up but the other is still young. She is looking after them and thanks to the support of her relatives they are able to get by. She does all her work between 8 am and 6 pm. 

Sonia has a sewing workshop where she makes blouses and dresses. Sickness is a great difficulty for her because when she is sick she still has to find the strength to continue somehow because she is the pillar of the household. 

With the loan she plans to purchase fabric and a sewing machine. One of her goals is to work for her family and to continue working with D-MIRO to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Leitu

texts.en:
Leitu is 28 years old, married, and has one child. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu (giant taro), and bananas, which she has been doing for many years.

Leitu is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy new equipment for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Leitu hopes to expand her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase shovels, bush knives, grass cutter, and gloves.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Being a responsible father, Joel aims to become successful in life to provide his family's needs and give his children a better life. Likewise, Joel aims to strengthen his resources to earn sufficient income for his family. 

He is 37 years old and has three school-age children. He wants to continue sending his children to school so that they will earn degrees and find good jobs someday. 

Due to the high cost of school fees and commodities, he engages himself in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. He plans to raise more piglets for fattening but he has not enough capital. Therefore, he is asking for an additional PHP 25,000 to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise. He believes that through this loan, he will work out his plan and hopes that someday he will make the business profitable.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Soknov's Group

texts.en:
Soknov, 42 years old, is a farmer who lives in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She has six children, five of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

She earns a living through planting cassava on a four-hectare area of farmland that she and her husband have been farming for ten years. Lack of  working capital for supporting the current business remains the main challenge for her.

Soknov has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three cycles already while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. The past loans have helped her to increase her income from the cassava planting business. 

Now leading her group of two to ask for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each, Soknov will use her portion to buy pesticides for protecting her cassava business and to pay for weeding fees. 

She hopes to gain a good quality from her cassava yield in order to sell it for a high price, so she can obtain a better standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for protecting her cassava business.

loans.name: 040138 Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mão is 49 years old and married with 4 children. She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 040138 Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường solidarity group. Mão supports 1 dependent with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Three other children are grown up. Mrs. Mão operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Mão faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase a net to fish.

In 2005, Mão joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Mão has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.



In the future, Mão hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a net to fish

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is a responsible mother who owns and manages a variety store in the Public Market to help her husband in gaining income for their family. She is 43 years old and has 3 school-age children. Due to the hardships of living, Marilou aimed to strengthen her variety store to generate sufficient income. She needed to earn a higher income so that they will continue sending their children to school and satisfy their necessities. She wants to ask for additional capital of 10,000 PHP to buy canned goods, noodles, seasonings, beverages, snack foods, soft drinks and vegetables to sell. She mentioned that this loan will be a great help for her to improve the business and she is hoping that she will make the business grow and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, seasonings, beverages, snack food, soft drinks and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha, 32 years old, is a farmer who lives in a rural village of the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province. She has one son who is dependent on her and still in school. To support the family, she has been growing corn on two and half hectares of farmland for four years and complements the family’s income by selling grocery items. The current business earns Chantha around 18,000 KHR per day and allows her to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Low crop yield resulting from drought is still the main challenge for her rice-paddy.

Chantha has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle already. She fully paid back the past loan which has helped her better support her family with sufficient food. Now she is leading her group, consisting of three members, to request a loan. Chantha, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy corn seeds and pesticides for her corn business and will use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes this loan will enable to get a high quality yield so as to sell it for a good price in order to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy corn seeds and pesticides for her corn business.

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Kampong Cham province's Ou Reang Ov district of Cambodia, Chea is a 63-year-old married mother of four children. The main source of her family's income is from rice farming, which she has engaged in for forty-three years in order to overcome her family's financial harship. She is able to earn approximately 15,000 Riel (KHR) per day and manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. 

This is the first loan for Chea's group with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She and her group member are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR and 500,000 KHR respectively. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice more productively so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Eteroma

texts.en: Eteroma is 33 years old, married, and has one child. She wants to start a small business making and selling fish in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a new canoe, spears, nets, and fishing lines. In the future, Eteroma hopes to help her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new canoe, spears, nets, and fishing lines

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 37 years old and married to Maricar. To make a living, Joseph provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. He has been engaged to his business for more than three years and earns approximately 300 PHP daily. Right now, Joseph is requesting a loan of  9,000 PHP which he will use to purchase paint, oil and gasoline for the maintenance of his business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase paint, oil and gasoline for the maintenance of his business.

loans.name: Taloa

texts.en: Taloa is a 44-year-old married woman with nine children. She would like to start growing taro, bananas and other crops to earn a living. Taloa has requested a loan to buy equipment for her business. She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Taloa will use her profits to supply her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy shovels, gloves, bush knives, a grass cutter and wheel barrow.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is 28 years old, married, and has five children. She wants to start a small business making and selling Elei printed fabric in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy brushes, fabric paint, rollers, and material. In the future, Salome hopes to develop her skills in Elei. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, brushes, and rollers

loans.name: Ulufafo

texts.en: Ulufafo is a 53-year-old married woman with four children. She makes and sells doughnuts, drinks, ice blocks and other items in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience with this business. Ulufafo needs a loan to purchase more goods for her business. She plans to use her profits to help supplement her family's income. Ulufafo has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil and a new frying pan.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is a 51-year-old married woman and mother of five. She has successfully run a small general store in her community for the last four years. She offers various items of goods for everyday use. She has good communication skills and has a large, regular clientele that prefer her store because she always has what they demand at reasonable prices. Her husband is a sales person at a garment shop and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 

With the help of Kashf Foundation, Khursheed has gradually improved her business.  She wants to grow her business and has requested a loan of 25000 PKR to buy grocery items and cleaning products in large quantity to meet the increasing demand. She wishes to utilize the earned profits for her daughter’s wedding and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and cleaning products in large quantity to meet the increasing demand.

loans.name: Tanveer

texts.en:
Tanveer is 22 years old, married, and has four children. She runs a general store, which she has been doing for six years. Her husband is employed as a sales person but does not earn enough to meet the family's basic needs. She took the initiative to start her business by taking a loan from Kashf Foundation to help support her family.  

Tanveer is requesting her second loan for 30,000 PKR, which she will use to buy stocks of rice, flour, and sugar to meet her customers’ demands. She hopes to use part of her revenue on her children’s well being and education.

loans.use: to purchase rice, flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Conrado

texts.en: Conrado is a 51-year-old living in Cabatuan. Conrado established a small store as a source of income. He has been running his store for almost one year. He would like to offer more products so he is requesting a loan for P18,000 to buy bottled beverages, eggs and noodles to sell in his store. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested so that he can further develop his business.

loans.use: to buy bottled beverages, eggs and noodles to sell in his store

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 35 years old and a married mother of four. She lives with her children in the town of Likoni, Kenya. Fatuma is a person who is recognized in her community. Ten years ago, she established her own food stall where she sells food such as rice, beans, and other dishes. Fatuma has an established clientele and attends to her customers throughout the entire day.

She is requesting her fourth loan from Yehu in the amount of 40,000 KES. Fatuma will use the loan to purchase ingredients like wheat flour, food flavoring, cooking oil, etc. Her plan is to work hard so that she can maintain a stable business and provide a good quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like wheat flour, food flavoring, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es: Artemio, de 46 años, es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de Palmer, su esposa desde hace 19 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos menores a los cuidan en su casa propia. Desde hace 19 años viene sembrando productos alimenticios como cereales, tubérculos y verduras. Los cuales cuida con mucho esmero. Su especialidad es la espinaca, el nabo y las alverjas; cuenta que en temporadas de cosecha los comerciantes mayoristas le pagan muy bien sus alimentos en el mercado de la ciudad de Jauja, donde visita con frecuencia ya que es el único. Además tiene vacas, toros pequeños y ovejas que vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. Ahora trabajan con mucho ahínco, él y su esposa; pues desean comprarse un terreno propio y de esa manera minimizar los gastos de arriendo, “ya me falta muy poco, estoy seguro de tener éxito”. Él pertenece al banco comunal “mujeres luchadoras” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, se siente agradecido con el apoyo que encontró en su asociación pues le permite mejorar el capital de trabajo de su negocio. Por esa razón promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Artemio; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus próximos sembríos.
texts.en:
Artemio, who is 46 years old, is a very responsible man. He lives with his wife of 19 years, Palmer. Together they have five minor children they care for at their own home. 

For 19 years he has been growing food products such as cereals, tuber and vegetables which need a lot of care. His specialty is spinach, turnip and peas. 

He says that in the harvest season the whole sellers pay him very well for his products on the market of the city of Jauja. He often visits this market because it is the only one. 

He also has cows, small bulls and sheep which he sells when there is a financial need. Now, he and his wife work very hard. They hope to buy their own piece of land to minimize the cost of rent this way. “I‘m almost there. I’m sure I will be successful”. 

He is a member of the communal bank “mujeres luchadores” and this is his fourth loan with MFP. 

He is grateful for the support he found in this institution because it allows him to improve his working capital. This is why he promises to pay the installments on time. 

Artermio will invest the money requested in the purchase of natural fertilizers to spray on his next sowing.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Maasoama

texts.en: Maasoama is a 22-year-old married woman and has no children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas and other crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. Maasoama has requested a loan to buy new equipment. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Maasoama hopes to earn more and then expand her business to improve the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy shovels, a wheel barrow and bush knives.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is 22 years old and lives in the beautiful city of Mombasa. She lives with her husband in a rental house that has electricity but no plumbed water. She has always been a hard-working woman and from a young age she has been helping her mother selling dumplings. Mwanatumu is using these enterprising skills to operate her own business selling fried potatoes at the market. She has good clientele base, the majority being school pupils.

She will use the loan to buy sacks of raw potatoes and cooking oil. Her dream for the future is to continue to move forward with her business to improve her income and to see her anticipated children educated (since she is currently childless).

loans.use: to buy sacks of raw potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface used his previous loan amount to buy material for use in his tailoring business.It was profitable and he was able to repay the loan in good time.

This being his second loan amount, he plans to buy more stock of material for use. He plans to use the anticipated income from his business to pay school fees for his children.

In the future, he hopes to grow his business and open a big clothes making shop, making more income and thereby improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of material for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita runs a general store where there are a number of competitors within her local community.  She would like to have a complete set of merchandise to compete with the other general stores. The capital intended for her general store is not sufficient due to an increased expense of her hog raising business and the maintenance of her corn field.  

Therefore, Carmelita is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy necessary merchandise.  With the loan, her profits will increase, which will enable her to send her two children to a higher level of education and to save for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Miguel Francisco

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre comerciante y constructor de 45 años de edad. El vive en Sololá con su esposa y sus tres hijos. Dos son mujeres una de 23 y  la otra de 19 años quienes ya lograron graduarse de sus estudios académicos del nivel medio y ahora  lo ayudan en su negocio  y un hombre de 17 años que trabaja con un tío realizando trabajos  en metal. 
Por la situación del des empleo que se vive en el país el con sus hijas deciden emprender un negocio aperturando una zapatería en el mercado de su residencia desde hace 4 meses.
El y sus hijas ven la demanda que se tiene por la venta de calzado necesitan seguir invirtiendo en mas mercadería y tener mejores ingresos para la familia. Ahora ellos necesitan un capital sobre un préstamo de Q 8,000.00 para comprar más y mejores calzados.
En el futuro el sueña poder darle los estudios universitarios a sus hijas ya que ellas tienen el animo de salir a delante.
texts.en:
Miguel, age 45, is a merchant and a builder.  He lives in Sololá with his wife and their three children.  The two girls, ages 23 and 19, have graduated from secondary school and now help him in his business.  His son, age 17, works with an uncle doing metal work.

Due to the unemployment situation in the country, he and his daughters decided to undertake a business.  They did this four months ago by opening a shoe store in the market where he lives.  He and his daughters see the demand there is for selling shoes.

They need to continue investing in more merchandise and to have better income for the family.  They now need a loan for 8,000 quetzales in order to buy more shoes and better shoes.

In the future he dreams of being able to give his daughters a university education.  They have the motivation to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy shoes in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Crestita

texts.en:
Handling a business was quite difficult at the start according to Crestita. But as time has passed, Crestita has learned a lot of things and has adopted new marketing strategies to improve her general store's business. She now manages livestock, a corn field, and a general store.

Crestita is married and has four children. Through the profits gained from raising hogs and corn crops she has been able to educate her children. Currently, she only spends some of her profit on education, as her youngest child is a fourth year college student.

Crestita's principle in life is to have a stable source of income, so that whenever she and her husband got weak they have their own savings to rely on in times of emergency. Crestita would like to ask for another loan of PHP 12,000 which will be used to buy more merchandise for her general store. Through this additional working capital, she could increase her sales and profits profits and provide greater custumer satisfaction.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of merchandise for her retail store

loans.name: Minda

texts.en: For the last nine years, Minda has earned a living by running a variety store. She has experienced many difficulties and hardships while doing this, but is determined to continue and expand her business. Her husband earns a living by farming and raising hogs, and she is very grateful for the way in which he has supported every decision that she has made. The couple has two children, both of whom are in school. Her dream for the future is to keep them in school so they can finish their studies and find better opportunities someday. Maria is looking for a way to strengthen her business because her household expenses are going up . That is why she is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more groceries to sell in her store. She knows that this loan will increase her profits because it will allow her to do a better job of satisfying customer demand and encourage more people to shop in her store.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a widow with three children who lives within the village of Pinto Alfonso Lista. She started her business selling fish in 2003. Gemma's youngest child is still studying, while the other two are working as laborers due to the living situation they have. 

She wants to increase the income she generates from her fish vending business so she can support her youngest child's education and improve their living situation. Gemma would like to ask for additional working capital of 10,000 PHP, allowing her to buy additional kilograms of fish to sell within her local community. She knows that through this loan she could earn greater income, which will help her provide her family with basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy additional kilograms of fish to sell

loans.name: Obida

texts.ru: Обида работает в  школе учительницей  и получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения 4 несовершеннолетних детей, так как ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Обиде нужны новые источники дохода. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» (To get ahead) организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей  скота, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Obida works as a schoolteacher and receives a low salary. Her wages are not sufficient for her to provide for her 4 young children because her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation. Obida needs new sources of income. To that end, she studied in a course entitled "To Get Ahead" that was organized by the Association of Businesswomen, and for which she earned a certificate.

Obida wants to set up a business in buying and selling cattle, since she has experience in this field. She plans to use the income to provide her children with a good education and nutritional food. Obida is seeking a loan in the amount of 3,000 Tajikistan Somoni to buy cattle so she can establish her business. She is waiting for your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy cattle to establish a new business

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina has made a living for the last five years by running a general store. She is 30 years old, single and wants to have financial stability and improve her standard of living so she no longer lives in poverty. She is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more items to sell in her store. She is a determined and persevering woman who doesn't give up and knows how to deal with obstacles in her life. Cristina is happy and thankful to God for the gradual improvement of her sales and profits. Her goal for the future is to continue this improvement.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Cecarcon 2 Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Cecarcon” está conformado por 22 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran; feriantes, venta de ropa, comida rápida, venta de humitas, ventas de artesanía, venta de productos plásticos, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Concepción.
Teorinda integrante del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie hacia el fondo del grupo, ocupando el tercer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste una chaqueta de color lila, usa aros grandes, su cabello lo usa corto y suelto es de color castaño claro.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de ropa, desde hace 8 años. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a domingo en su casa, otras veces sale a ofrecer su mercadería fuera de su casa, su horario de trabajo es de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería que va necesitando para su negocio, la compra en l a ciudad de Santiago en diferentes tiendas y distribuidoras de ropa a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará poleras, vestidos, faldas, ropa para grandes y chicos.
Una de las metas de Teorinda es habilitar un espacio en su casa para colocar  un bazar con su venta de ropa para atender a su clientela de forma más tranquila y cómoda, así con esto generar mayores ingresos para su familia. 
Teorinda vive junto a su 2 hijos, una nieta y sobrino que lo tiene a su cuidado y 2 hermanos que también cuida ya que son inválidos.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado la s capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Cecarcon." It consists of 22 entrepreneurs who work in different businesses, among which are working at fairs, selling clothing, fast food, selling humitas (a traditional steam-cooked ground corn dish), selling handicrafts, selling plastic products, and services, among others. All the members are from the city of Concepción.

Teorinda, a member of the communal bank, is standing at the back of the group in the photo. She is in the third position, going from left to right. She is wearing  a lilac-colored jacket and big hoop earrings. Her hair is short and worn loose, and it is light brown. She has been working in the area of clothing sales for eight months. She comments that she works from Monday to Sunday in her home. Other times she goes out to offer her merchandise outside of her home. Her working schedule depends on her availability.

She buys the merchandise that she needs for her business at low cost in various stores and clothing distributors in the city of Santiago, thus it is economically convenient. With the loan she will buy T-shirts, dresses, skirts, and clothing for the summer season. One of Teorinda's goals to set up a space in her house to arrange a bazaar for her clothing sales in order to attend to her customers in a more peaceful and comfortable manner, and in this way generate greater income for her family.

Teorinda lives with her two children, a granddaughter, and a nephew who are in her care and two brothers whom she also cares for since they are disabled. She is very happy and appreciative of the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza, since it will allow her to invest in her business. With respect to the communal bank group of which she is a part, she comments that there is very good communication in it. In addition, the training has served her to learn new strategies for sales and accounting.

Concepción is located at the mouth of the Biobio river, one of the largest in the country, in the south of Chile in the Biobio region. It has had an important function in Chilean history, being the site of important battles and relevant settlements, especially during the Arauco War, because of being on the border of the Mapuche territory. Now the city has important economic and demographic development, having come to be considered one of the urban, demographic, administrative, financial, and commercial centers of Chile, after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: Comprará poleras, vestidos, faldas, ropa para grandes y chicos.

loans.name: Dennys

texts.es:
Dennys tiene 61 años y se dedica a la  venta de mercancía  y comidas rápidas, su familia la conforman su esposo y seis hijos en las edades de  26 a 40 años, con quienes sueña verlos muy exitosos.   
Dennys en su experiencia de negocio de hace 32 años, ha logrado apoyar los ingresos de su hogar y sostenerse en el mercado, con mucha creatividad. Su idea emprendedora nació, porque su cónyuge tenía un negocio muy grande de comidas y allí aprendió a elaborar muchos de los productos que hoy vende.  
Desde el año 1985 decidió emprender un restaurante con la ayuda de tres hermanos, pero solo existió hasta hace un año, cuando se vinculó totalmente a la venta de productos por catálogos y convirtió su restaurante en un negocio de comidas rápidas, donde vende salchipapas, perros calientes, sándwich, hamburguesas, entre otras delicias, que combina creativamente para deleitar a su clientela.  Dennys tiene a su vez  un espacio adecuado en su casa, donde vende en  temporada navideña, carnes frías para la cena de nochebuena en familia y también comercializa  productos de tocador. Todas sus ventas las realiza   directamente, así sus clientes se acercan a su negocio y/o ella los visita y les vende de contado y a crédito; sus compras de insumos alimenticios las realiza en    Salsamentarías, y las de mercancías cosméticas a grandes distribuidores, que le entregan una revista periódicamente para que comercialice sus productos. Sus principales clientes son empleados, dueños de fábrica, vecinos y referidos, que la reconocen y hacen sus pedidos cada vez que lo requieren; entre sus metas mas adelante está la de  adecuar su nuevamente un espacio para su restaurante,  con el fin de ofrecer un ambiente confortable y climatizado a su clientela; además de independizar el negocio de la vivienda, con el fin de lograr cada vez mas sosiego personal.
En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará  mercancías, tales como perfumes, cosméticos, artículos del hogar, cremas, artículos de tocador;  Dennys proyecta que su negocio mejore con esta inversión, debido a que tendría productos disponibles para aumentar  a su clientela, porque tiene cuentas por cobrar y algunas veces lo que recupera, no es suficiente para complacer los pedidos de sus clientela, especialmente  para el día del amor y la amistad, época de gran impacto en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Dennys, 61, makes a living selling merchandise and fast food.  Her family is made up of her husband and six children, ages 26-40; she dreams of their success.  With 32 years of experience and great creativity, Dennys has managed to help with the household income and support herself in the market.  Her enterprising idea was born because her spouse had a large food business where she learned to make many of the products she sells today.

In 1985 she decided to start a restaurant with the help of her three brothers, but it only has existed since a year ago, when she started to sell exclusively catalogue products and converted her restaurant into a fast-food business where she sells "salchipapas" [fried potatoes and sausages], hot dogs, sandwiches, hamburgers, and other tasty foods that she combines creatively for the enjoyment of her customers.

Dennys has adapted a space in her house where during the Christmas season she sells cold meat for the Christmas Eve family dinner.  She also sells beauty products.  She makes all her sales directly, so her customers come to her business or she visits them and sells for cash and credit.  She buys her food supplies in delicatessens and her cosmetics from large distributors who give her a catalogue periodically she she'll sell their products.

Her main customers are employees, factory owners, neighbors, and referrals who know her and make requests every time they need something.  Among her long-term goals is adapting a space for her restaurant to offer her customers a comfortable and air-conditioned ambiance.  She also wants to separate the business from her house so she can have more quiet for herself.

Currently she's applying for a Kiva loan to buy merchandise such as perfume, cosmetics, household items, creams, and beauty products.  Dennys projects that her business will improve with this investment because she'll have products available to expand her clientele, because she has bills to collect and sometimes she doesn't recover them.  It's not enough to satisfy her customers' requests, especially for the Day of Love and Friendship [third Saturday in September in Colombia], a big sales period for her.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cosmetics, household items, cream, and beauty products

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José es un hombre agricultor de 57 años de edad. El vive en Sololá con su esposa y tiene 10 hijos. Viven con el 9 de sus hijos 7 mujeres,  2 hombres y también unos nietos.
El ahora cultiva tomate, maíz  y  frijol. El Empezó a cultivar tomate desde hace 3 años por que se dio cuenta que sus ingresos económicos no le alcanzaban para cuidar a toda su familia. Así que esta verdura mantiene mejores precios en el mercado  la cual ha mejorado un poco su economía.
El ve su necesidad de obtener un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para seguir invirtiendo en la compra de plantillas de tomate, abono, insecticida y más. 
Con las ganancias que tenga en un futuro de la comercialización del tomate el quiere construir  una mejor vivienda para sus hijos así mismo terminar de darles los estudios académicos a sus hijos mas pequeños.
texts.en:
José is a 57 year old farmer.  He lives in Sololá with his wife, and he has ten children.  They live with nine of their children, seven women and two men, and some grandchildren.

He now grows tomatoes, corn, and beans.  He started to grow tomatoes three years ago.  He realized that his income was not enough to take care of all of his family.  This vegetable maintains better prices in the market, which has slightly improved his finances.

He sees the need to get a loan for 4,000 quetzales in order to continue buying small tomato plants, natural fertilizers, insecticide, and more.

With the income that he will have from future tomato sales he wants to build a better house.  He wants to do this so that his children, in turn, finish giving their small children an education.

loans.use: to buy small tomato plants to cultivate.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi is 23 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is too young to go to school. She has always enjoyed working and came up with the idea that she should learn how to style hair. Because she is very passionate about caring for her family, she has worked hard to meet her family's expenses and care for her children. With the earnings from her beauty salon, Mwanamisi has been able to invest in her small business. She works alone from 8 A.M. to 6 P.M., Monday through Saturday, and is requesting this loan to buy dyes, shampoo and other supplies. She dreams of seeing her business and income grow and someday having more customers.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoo and other supplies.

loans.name: Priscillar

texts.en: Priscillar is 30 years old and lives in the town of Nyahururu with her husband and three children, all of whom attend school. For the last two years, she has earned a living by running a tailoring business which is doing well. She has applied for her first loan from KADET Ltd., for KES. 10,000, to buy knitting wools to use in her business. Her goal for the future is to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy knitting wools for a tailoring business.

loans.name: Aliboi

texts.ru: Алибой занимается откормом скота  около 10 лет. Он трудолюбивый человек и хороший семьянин. Он воспитывает троих детей. У него дома есть несколько голов скота, его мать продает молоко и молочные изделия соседям и отправляет на рынок.  Кроме того, он имеет магазин, где  продает продукты питания. Его жена работает в этом магазине продавщицей. Но основной его доход от выращивание скота. Поэтому он обратился в нашу организацию за поддержкой, хочет купить скот и закупить корма для них на зиму.  Он сотрудничает с нашей организацией в течении 2 лет и надеется на дальнейшее сотрудничество и поддержку.
texts.en: Aliboi has been raising cattle for about 10 years. He is a good, hard-working family man who is raising 3 kids. Aliboi has several head of cattle at home, and his mother sells milk and other dairy products to neighbours as well as at the market. In addition, Aliboi has a shop where his wife works selling food items. However, his main income is from the cattle, and it is for this reason that Aliboi has come to MDO Arvand for support. He wants to buy cattle and stock up on cattle feed for them for the winter. Aliboi has been cooperating with Arvand for the past two years, and hopes to be able to count on further cooperation and support.

loans.use: to buy cattle and  cattle feed

loans.name: Duo Campo Bajo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Campo Bajo.
Este Grupo está integrado por la señora Dora Esperanza quien es originaria de San Juan Comalapa, es soltera de 32 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de  tejidos típicos a mano sus ventas las realiza de forma ambulante, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia Prima para la elaboración de tejidos típicos, ya que necesita producir más para generar ganancias.
texts.en:
Campo Bajo Duo

Dora Esperanza, a native of San Juan Comalapa, is a member of this group.  She's 32 years old and single.  She earns a living making traditional textiles by hand and makes her sales as a street vendor.

She's requesting this loan to buy materials to make traditional textiles because she needs to produce more to generate earnings.

loans.use: to buy materials to make traditional textiles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for a candle-making business.

loans.name: Burmakan

texts.ru:
Бурмакан 52 года, имеет 4 дочерей. Бурмакан в качестве основного дохода для ее семьи, с 2002 года занимается торговлей детской и подростковой одеждой на рынке, начав этот бизнес с суммы 30,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Бурмакан, на сегодняшний  день у нее в обороте 130,000 сом, ежемесячный доход составляет около 20,000 сом. Доходы от бизнеса позволяют Бурмакан оплачивать обучение средней дочери. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурмакан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп партии детской школьной и повседневной одежды на предстоящий сезон.  Доходы от кредита Бурмакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса посредством открытия второй торговой точки, а на следующий год выдать дочь замуж.
texts.en:
Burmakan is 52 years old and has 4 daughters. As the main breadwinner of the family, in 2002 Burmakan began selling clothes for children and teenagers at the market. She started this business with only 30,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, her turnover is 130,000 Som and the monthly income from her business is about 20,000 Som. These earnings allow Burmakan to pay for her middle daughter's education. 

Burmakan has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 Som for the purpose of further developing her business. She will use these funds to stock up on children's clothes for school and casual wear for the upcoming season. Burmakan will use the profit generated by this loan to expand her business by opening another sales outlet, and to pay for her daughter's wedding expenses next year.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothes for reselling

loans.name: Natalia  Karina

texts.es:
Natalia tiene 22 años  es madre soltera tiene un niño. Tiene una tienda  y trabaja de lunes a domingos no descansa ni un solo día empieza a las 6:00 am hasta las a10:30pm. 
Ella empezó con este negocio porque su mama tenia una tienda. Ella comenzó a tener pasión y entusiasmo  por este negocio ya que le gusta interactuar con las personas. Con el prestamo quiere comprar viveres como granos, aceite, azucar, bebidas, verduras etc. 
Su sueño es tener una casa y crecer en su negocio  ella le pide a Dios  sabiduría para lograr lo quiere y desea.
texts.en:
Natalia, 22, is the single mother of one child.  She has a store and works Monday through Sunday without resting even a single day.  She begins at 6 a.m. and works until 10:30 p.m.  She started this business because her mother had a store.  She became impassioned and enthusiastic about the business because she likes to interact with people.

With the loan she wants to buy provisions such as grains, oil, sugar, beverages, vegetables, etc.

Her dream is to have a house and to grow in the business.  She asks God for wisdom to achieve what she wants and desires.

loans.use: to buy grains, oil, sugar, beverages, and vegetables

loans.name: Chance Group

texts.fr: La cliente Suzana  est entrepreneur, leader  et doyenne du groupe d’affaire Chance, âgée d’environ 60 ans, mariée, mère de 10 enfants.  Son conjoint est un chef d’avenue. La  cliente est vendeuse des braises. Elle s’installe dans le petit marché Afia Bora. Depuis sa jeunesse, elle exerce cette activité.  Vers 2008, elle bénéficia de premier crédit de l’IMF Hekima pour  renforcer  son capital. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire en achetant 10 sacs de braises. Elle ambitionne pérenniser  son entreprise. La cliente confirme avoir réalisé tant des projets avec le crédit de l’IMF Hekima. La cliente remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes non bancables.
texts.en:
This client, Suzana, is an entrepreneur and the  leader and most senior member of the business group Chance. She is about 60 years old and the mother of ten children. Her husband is a local leader. This client is a charcoal vendor. She is set up at the Afia Bora small market and has been doing this work since she was young. 

Around 2008, she benefited from an initial loan from the microfinance institution Hekima for bolstering her capital. This new loan must serve to increase her sales by purchasing 10 sacks of charcoal. Her ambition is to make her enterprise sustainable. 

This client confirms she has fulfilled so many projects with Hekima loans. She thanks Hekima for its actions dedicated to poor unbanked women.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 34 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Luzon. Remedios runs a sari-sari (general) store, which she has been doing for three years.  She earns 300 PHP a day. 

Remedios is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy canned goods, noodles, candies, biscuits, and condiments to sell.  She is willing to work hard every day to lift her family out of poverty. With her loan, she hopes to expand her business and increase her income to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, candies, biscuits, and condiments.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James, 27-year old, is a married entrepreneur from Clarin with 1 child. He is earning from his fish pond business. It has been almost a year since he started his business and now he earns 6,000 PHP a month. To improve business, he is borrowing 10,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit, which he just joined last 2011. He will use the funds to buy young fish to raise and twine to expand the business. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy twine and young fish to raise in order to expand the business.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana tiene 35 años  y genera ingresos mediante la venta de comidas rápidas. Como perros calientes, hamburguesas y diversas combinaciones que ofrece permanentemente, con tal de agradar el paladar de su clientela.  Su idea de negocio nació porque su esposo laboraba en un restaurante reconocido de comidas rápidas, y ella viéndolo, decidió empezar su propia aventura de negocios; así lo hizo  con la venta de perros calientes  en una carro alquilado con el que le fue bien, logrando mas adelante, adquirir un carro de perros calientes de segunda y agregó la pizza como un nuevo producto, pues aprendió a elaborarla y decidió comprar el horno para ofrecerla; gradualmente adquirió sillas y mesas, para acomodar a sus compradores y hoy es un punto muy reconocido, donde vende al detal a clientes particulares  e incluyó el servicio de domicilio; sus ventas las realiza  de contado y   de Jueves a Domingo, así como las compras las cuales hace en salsamentarías  de la ciudad de Barranquilla y  sus principales clientes son los vecinos del sector. Su meta es ampliar el negocio, mejorar su producto cada vez más, agregándole su creatividad, nuevos ingredientes y en su negocio una atención inigualable tanto con sus clientes como con sus proveedores, además de   pagar puntualmente el crédito para en el futuro crecer y adquirir una vivienda, superando el gran desafío permanente, que es el insuficiente capital de trabajo para responder mas rápido a sus sueños.
En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  el cual  invertirá en comprar perros calientes, hamburguesas, salchipapas, chuzos, desgranadas, pizzas, papitas, panes, salsas entre otros insumos; con esta inversión mejorará su negocio porque ofrecerá nuevos productos y logrará incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Susana is 35 years old, and makes a living operating a fast food stand. She sells dishes such as: hot dogs, hamburgers, pizzas and other delicious combinations. She first had the idea for her business when her husband was working at a fast food restaurant, and she was observing the food industry process. Shortly thereafter, she decided to start her own adventure in food sales, and began selling hot dogs from a rented cart. As business began to grow, Susana added a second cart to her operation, and also started selling pizzas. Since she has learned how to prepare and make all her food dishes, she decided to buy an oven to broaden the scope of her operations. Gradually, as her business kept growing, Susana slowly added tables and chairs to the area around her stand so that she could accommodate more customers. Today, her's is a popular, well-known food stand that also delivers to customers' homes. She accepts cash payments for food items, and operates her stand Thursday through Sunday every week. The other days of the week, she goes to Barranquilla to purchase food from delis to stock her food stand for the rest of the week. 

Susana's goal is to grow and strengthen her business, and to continually improve the quality of her food and the products she offers to her customers, most of whom are from nearby neighborhoods and areas. She tries to constantly add new ingredients and be creative with her dishes, and she always makes an effort to treat her customers and suppliers very well. Susana promises to make punctual payments in this, her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase food for her stand, including: hot dogs, hamburgers, pizza, sausages, french fries, breads, sauces, etc. She hopes that this investment will help her to improve her business and offer a wider variety of products to her customers, leading to increased sales.

loans.use: to purchase hot dogs, hamburgers, sausages, pizzas, french fries, bread, sauces and other items for her food stand.

loans.name: Luis Rodrigo

texts.es:
Luis tiene 26 años, cursó la secundaria y vive con su pareja de 24 años con quien tiene un hijo de apenas 2 meses, viven en la casa de los padres de Luis que se encuentra en Latacunga capital de la provincia de Cotopaxi, una de las provincias que forma parte de la Región Sierra del Ecuador y que los últimos años se ha desarrollado notablemente de tal forma que es considerada una de las más importantes de la región gracias a la industria florícola, minera, metalúrgica, agroindustria, agrícola y ganadera. Además existen establecimientos de negocios que generan interesantes ingresos lo que le convierte en una ciudad comercial y con varias oportunidades para salir adelante. Latacunga es una acogedora ciudad que atrae a sus turistas por sus estrechas calles decoradas con coloniales calles e iglesias arquitectónicas que conservan la típica fachada de años atrás.
Luis encontró la oportunidad de crecimiento en la actividad ganadera que le enseñaron sus padres y en la cual emprendió desde que era muy niño hace 20 años. Cada día invierte 2 o 3 horas en las actividades más demandantes y el cuidado en general de los animales lo realiza su esposa. Luis combina la actividad de producción de leche con la crianza de cerdos para su posterior comercialización. Luis acudió a Fundación Alternativa por la oportunidad de crecimiento, y el apoyo que brindan al sector rural con créditos y capacitaciones oportunos, por lo que solicitó un crédito con el cual comprará más animales para incrementar su producción y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos con los que luego podrá hacer realidad su sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Luis is 26 years old, has finished secondary school, and lives with his wife who is 24. They have a child, just 2 months old, and live in Luis's parents house, located in Latacunga. This is the capital of Cotopaxi province, part of Ecuador's sierra region. 

The region has developed notably in recent years, so much so that it's now considered among the most important, thanks to its flower-growing, mining, metallurgy, agro-industry, agriculture and cattle-raising. In addition, there are business establishments that generate notable incomes, converting it into a commercial city with various opportunities to get ahead. Latacunga is a welcoming city that attracts tourists with its narrow, decorated, colonial streets and its architectonic churches that conserve the typical facades of past years.

Luis sees an opportunity to expand his cattle-raising activity, which he was taught by his parents, starting in early childhood some 20 years ago. Each day, he invests 2 or 3 hours in the most demanding activities while his wife is responsible for the general care of the animals. Luis combines milk-producing activity with raising pigs for later sale.

Luis approached the Fundacion Alternativa hoping to expand, and seeking the help it offers the rural sector with loans and training opportunities. He solicited a loan to buy more animals and increase milk production. In this manner, Luis hopes to improve their incomes so that, later, he can make his dream of having his own house a reality.

loans.use: buy more cows and increase milk production.

loans.name: Pingdataaba Group

texts.fr:
Mme IRENE est  responsable du groupe PINGDATAABA. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 07ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 01 va à l’école et elle a 04personnes en charge.

Mme vend des pagnes  depuis 11 ans. Elle s’approvisionne  à Lomé et au  marché du secteur 10. Ses clients sont les amis et voisinage.

Elle veut s’acheter 20 pièces de pagnes, et 10 complets  bazin.

Avec ses économies, elle veut améliorer son activité. Elle ambitionne aider son mari dans la scolarisation des enfants et s’acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Ms. IRENE is the official of the group PINGDATAABA. She is a married mother of two children. The oldest is 7 years old, and the youngest is 3, and one of them goes to school. She has four persons to support.

Ms. IRENE has been selling 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) for eleven years. She gets her supplies from Lomé and at the Sector 10 market. Her customers are friends and neighbors.

She wants to purchase 20 lengths of 'pagne' cloth and 10 outfits of damask fabrics. 

With her savings, she wants to improve her business. Her ambition is to help out her husband in covering her children's schooling costs and to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth and damask outfits to sell

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard used his previous loan amount to buy more stock of goods to sell in his retail business. It was profitable and he was able to pay the loan amount back well and in good time.

He now has a pharmacy where he sells medicine and clinic equipment.With this loan, being his second loan amount, he plans to buy more stock of medicine and clinical equipment so that he can offer good services to his customers.

In the future, Benard hopes to grow his pharmacy business and make more income, hence improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to add more stock of medicine and clinical equipment.

loans.name: Maluti

texts.en:
Maluti is 49 years old, married and has eight children. He does livestock farming to earn a living. He has been in the business for 10 years. He has employed one person in his business. His desire is to practice large-scale farming in the future.

Maluti has requested a loan of 10,000 KES to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Hailma is asking for a new loan so as to expand her existing food selling business. She says thanks for the previous loan that boosted her water vending business. Her food vending business is also doing well. 

Halima is asking for this loan to purchase ingredients like wheat flour, baking powder, sugar and cooking oil. These are the items needed for making dumplings, which she sells from home and later at the market. She thanks Yehu and Kiva lenders for the support given.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like wheat flour, baking powder, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is from the village where she generates income. She has been a hog-raiser for four years. She is 51 years old, and is married to Artemio, a father who managed their farm land. 

Right now, Myrna is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 8,000 to buy feed and vaccine to sustain the growth of her hogs. She believes that through her patience and sacrifices she will be rewarded with good income someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccine to sustain the growth of her hogs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more snacks and dried fish to resell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a responsible mother of three children. She is married to Modesto, a farmer in the village of Luzon. To make a living, Angelina is engaged in a hog-raising business. She has been engaged in this business for over nine years and earns about PHP 2,500 every time she sells in the market. 

Currently, Angelina is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for the proper growth of her hogs. She believes that her patience and sacrifices will be rewarded with good income someday.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for the proper growth of her hogs.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a 69 year old woman and a mother of five grown up children. She is a dressmaker and has been running a tailoring business in their place in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines for more than thirty years now. This is her source of income in meeting the needs of the family.

Elsa joined CEVI in order to gain access to the financial services offered by the organization. She wants to take another loan since she already paid the previous one. She is requesting for a loan worth 5,000 PHP to buy materials for sewing such as cloth, thread and others. With this, she will be able to cater to more customers who will come to her shop for her services.

Elsa believes that this loan could definitely help her in making her business successful.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing such as cloth, thread and others.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
This is Mary Ann, she previously accessed an 30,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and to pay for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. Her earnings were a big help in funding the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Mary Ann would like to apply for another 32,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and to pay for the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mary Ann dreams of being able to buy another jeepney soon. She also dreams that her children will finish their education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

**Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn income, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai is a 32-year-old single female from Sahab in Jordan. She has requested a loan of 500 JOD to buy clothes to resell. In the future she would like to have her own shop and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes for reselling

loans.name: Raisa

texts.ru:
Раиса занимается торговлей на рынке. Она уже около 17 лет реализует мужскую обувь и одежду на одном из местных рынков Мелитополя. Имея хороший опыт и собственную торговую точку, Раиса смогла хорошо подняться и наработать базу постоянных клиентов. 
Раисе необходимы дополнительные средства в размере 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести партию осенне-зимнего товара для последующей его реализации на своей точке. За счет полученной от КИВА суммы Раиса надеется далее развивать свой бизнес и улучшать быт семьи.
texts.en: Raisa works in retail at a market. For the past 17 years, Raisa has been selling men's footwear and clothing at one of the local markets in Melitopol. Thanks to being well experienced and having her own market stall, Raisa has been able to establish a regular clientele and has become successful. Raisa now needs a loan of 10,000 Ukrainian Hryvnia (UAH) to purchase autumn and winter goods to sell at her outlet. Raisa hopes to use the money from Kiva to further develop her business and improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase autumn and winter clothing for re-sale at her market stall

loans.name: Owolo Owo 2 Group

texts.fr: OWOLO OWO 2 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Karimatou Ayinkè (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un certain Manfiou. Le couple a un enfant à leur charge, scolarisé. Karimatou Ayinkè vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Karimatou Ayinkè n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a très longtemps que Karimatou Ayinkè mène comme activité la vente de nourriture et de divers articles à son domicile. Karimatou Ayinkè exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Karimatou Ayinkè s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Karimatou Ayinkè sollicite un deuxième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe OWOLO OWO 2. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Le crédit précédemment reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
OWOLO OWO 2 is a group of three persons whose members are friends residing in the same district. The group's representative, Karimatou Ayinkè (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 38 years old and married to a man named Manfiou. The couple have one child in school to support. Karimatou Ayinkè lives together with her child and husband. The couple jointly ensure that the different expenses are covered. 

Karimatou Ayinkè did not attend school. For a very long time, she has been selling food and a variety of goods out of her home. She operates her business with passion, and this enables her to meet her needs and those of her child. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers, Karimatou Ayinkè is requesting, along with the other members of the group OWOLO OWO 2, a second loan for responding better to customer demands and making more profit. The previously received loan was indeed repaid.

loans.use: to purchase various goods and some containers of oil to sell from home

loans.name: Hohoué Bernardine's Group

texts.fr: MASSAVO 5 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies appartenant à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Hohoué Bernardine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 45 ans et est mariée à un certain Luc. Le couple a deux enfants à leur charge, tous scolarisés. Hohoué Bernardine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Hohoué Bernardine a peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de quinze ans que Hohoué Bernardine mène comme activité la vente des céréales (soja) et de divers articles (chaussures, etc.) à son domicile. Hohoué Bernardine exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Hohoué Bernardine s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Hohoué Bernardine sollicite un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MASSAVO 5. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
MASSAVO 5 is a group of three persons whose members are friends belonging to the same tontine group. The group's representative, Hohoué Bernardine (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 45 years old and married to a man named Luc. The couple support two children, both in school. Hohoué Bernardine lives together with her children and husband. The couple jointly ensure that the different expenses are covered for the children. 

Hohoué Bernardine has had little schooling. For nearly fifteen years, she has been selling grains (soybeans) and a variety of goods (shoes, etc.) out of her home. She operates her business with passion, and this enables her to meet her needs and those of her children. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers, Hohoué Bernardine is requesting, along with the other members of the group MASSAVO 5, a loan for responding better to customer demands and making more profit.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and various goods to sell from home

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise is aged 48. She is married to a farmer and they have four children. She has been a maize farmer for 10 years. She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and to pay for fertilizer during maize production; she needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With the profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to support the labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 38 years old and is married with three children between 8 and 17 years old. They live in Nakuru. 

For the past eight years, Ruth has had a business selling different types of clothes. She has applied for her second loan from KADET Ltd. to enable her buy more clothes, such as ladies' suits and jackets, to add to her stock for the coming high season.

She hopes to have a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Jazi

texts.en:
Jazi is from Israel’s Negev. He needs this loan to purchase a solar home system, which will replace his family’s diesel-powered generator and provide electricity for their home. 

Not all Bedouins in Israel have access to the electricity grid and many depend on diesel-fueled generators for their electricity needs. This loan provides this borrower with access to a solar-powered generator, positively impacting both the borrower's home and the environment.

loans.use: To purchase a solar home system to replace his family’s diesel-powered generator.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья – предприниматель из Мелитополя. Она работает на одном из местных рынков, торгует качественной женской обувью. Этим бизнесом начала заниматься еще 5 лет назад. 
Наталья надеется использовать средства, полученные от КИВА в размере 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить новый сезонный товар. Осенью хорошо идет демисезонная обувь – ботинки, ботильоны, сапоги, поэтому Наталья надеется хорошо реализовать купленный товар и неплохо заработать этой осенью.
texts.en: Natalya is an entrepreneur from Melitopol.  She works at one of the local markets, selling quality women's shoes.  She started this business five years ago.  Natalya hopes to use the loan in the amount of 5000 hryvnia, obtained from Kiva, to purchase new seasonal merchandise.
